Reviews.Title: Great picture, DLNA shows promise, a few flaws - what's with the PIP
Reviews.Author: Deux Bits "These go to Eleven"
Reviews.Content: I have only had this TV for a few days, so this is not a complete review, but I wanted to warn others about some issues that they may find important.Picture quality is great - I have not run a calibration or tested various known sources for difficult to reproduce scenes or motion. The blacks are so good that the image color looks over saturated at the factory default setting when placed next to a panel with lower contrast ratio. (It should be kept in mind that the eye has a logarithmic response to light, and a 50,000:1 contrast ratio may not be that much more than a 30,000:1 ratio.) In the store I was comparing this panel to a 46a550 and 46a530 all at their factory default settings. The 550's image was more natural looking at the factory default setting.Watching SD analog content on digital TVs can be annoying with various artifacts visible in the conversion of the analog signal to the native digital of the TV. This TV does a very respectable job of this - with the SD images mostly just looking fuzzy and soft compared to digital content - pretty much what one might expect.The TOC feature seems like a waste of time and may introduce some issues with light bleeding in from the environment. Not a problem for me in my home environment.So, if I was happy with the image on the 550 why did I get a 750? Two reasons - Motion blur: the 650 and 750 panels have higher response times and higher refresh rates thus reducing LCD motion blur artifacts, and reason two: DLNA... DNLA is a very nice feature - super nice - I hope it takes off.DLNA takes advantage of networking and media stored on a PC to provide viewable content through the TV. What's really going on here is that the TV designers are taking advantage of the computer they have inside the TV to enable them to do more digital media things with the TV. The TV has an Ethernet network interface - wireless or wired. We're computer geeks, we have a fairly robust network and my family has a strong interest in Internet downloads of various media content - in particular video. I have various foreign video content that I cannot get on a DVD. Netflix and others (Amazon, Apple, etc) have downloadable video content, although the DRM on much of this content is a problem. The rub is you have to watch this downloaded content on a PC, or a PC hooked directly up to a TV display or some other media PC kludge. DLNA helps get around some of these issues. The DLNA capability of this model is remarkable, not perfect, but still great. You have to install a piece of software on the computer that provides a way for the PC to share content on the PC through the network interface for the TV to "see".  On the TV, you use the W.link feature to access the shared content on the PC. Music, Images and Videos stored on the PC are all accessible through the TV.  Remarkably easy to access and view on the TV. Fantastic. There are a few glitches - The software on the PC was not able to handle all the media I threw at it in the first go around - I backed off (why would I play music through a TV?) and the software was able to complete it's build of it's database of content on the PC. I hope this problem will get cured in future versions of the DLNA server software that runs on the PC. Another small glitch was that when I decided to end my watching of these shows stored on the PC and I exited the w.link feature it appeared to crash the TV's OS. I had older firmware (1004), so I updated to 1007 and I hope this might cure the problem, although I have no evidence of this yet.So DLNA looks very promising but it is not perfect. I have not tried viewing content that is locked with DRM of some kind, but I strongly suspect this is not going to work. Further proof that DRM is seriously flawed. Legitimate users (paying customers) should not be restricted in their reasonable use of the content.The remote seems sufficiently user friendly - some lettering is large enough for older eyes to read easily and the back lighting feature works the way it should making it easier to _read_ the keys in the dark.The manual's content seems complete and readable but the manual has a major and very annoying flaw. The manual is large with many many pages so being able to refer to page numbers is crucial. It does have page numbers but I defy you to read them in anything other than bright sunlight! They are black numbers printed on a gray field. Strangest printing setup I've ever seen.  In the grand scheme of things this is only a minor detail but it is strange - the company knows about the importance of contrast. If I can download the manual as a searchable and linked pdf I won't care.I have not yet discovered a way to edit the channel description in the channel list. A few digital channels have the information on what their station ID is, but many do  not. I have not found a way to add or edit a description that tells me that, for instance, cable channel 117-25 is actually broadcast 33-1 or WBFS or some other more identifiable name.I also am not yet aware if one can apply individual optimizations to each input. If one can this would be ideal.Another minor point - I'm not too sure how "green" this TV is in it's energy use. I was quite surprised to discover it was noticeably warm when standing next to it while on.Finally, my two major disappointments with this TV are:1) PIP feature - which is quite limited, more like a cheesy cheap faux PIP. First, access to the PIP feature is not at all easy - one has to navigate various menus and sub menus to get at it. But the real problem is that the TV does not have a second tuner of any sort - you cannot watch two channels and swap between them without a second tuner connected through one of the external sources. In fact the PIP limits you to only being able to watch the built in Tuner content in the sub window of the main display which must be using an external source of a specific variety. Strange.... for a high end flagship product to have this kind of limited functionality... A little disturbing and makes you wonder what other cost cutting decisions one might discover with this product in the future.2) The fixed base - the base does not swivel despite what the specifications at various sites say. I'll have to get a turntable.Overall - where it matters most - the picture is spectacular. LCDs have come a long way. The picture makes me smile - it's just fun to watch.

Reviews.Title: LN46A750
Reviews.Author: ER "ER"
Reviews.Content: I currently have a Sony KDL-40XBR2, and wanted an upgrade, and wasn't sure wether to purchase a KDL-46XBR4 model or this new Samsung LN46A750 model. After doing extensive research, I decided to go with the Samsung LN46A750. I purchased this TV a few days ago, and this tv is simply amazing. Reviews.Title: Simply Astounding!
Reviews.Author: A. Meschkow
Reviews.Content: I have been researching the best price versus value for Samsung and other brand LCD 720P & 1080P televisions for at least 2 years by reading the reviews.  I was just about to purchase Samsung model LNT4665 (Highest Rated) when I noticed that this model LN46A750 was released in April. Samsung LCD TV's have a great track record for picture quality and reliability, so I purchased this model even though there were no reviews posted on Amazon yet.The price is at least a $1000 lower than the retail chain stores and the FREE "White Glove" delivery is an added bonus. Amazon's white glove delivery means that the TV is brought into your home, carton removed and placed on your TV stand for no extra cost. At that point you can power it up and check for defects (dead pixels) before you sign the delivery receipt.Now onto picture quality. This 1080P LCD TV's picture quality is simply astounding!. The contrast levels rival that of Plasma televisions. Up until recently, Plasma televisions had far superior contrast levels. This TV has 50,000:1 contrast ratio. You can also customize color, sharpness, contrast, picture, gama and brightness settings manually if you want; just like a computer monitor.The sound quality is decent for my needs, but if you want true surround sound, you'll have to add an amplifier/receiver.This is a great buy at $2140 and change, you can't beat it with a stick!

Reviews.Title: Superb picture quality and great sound
Reviews.Author: Kanishk Rastogi "Freelenser"
Reviews.Content: After doing a lot of research online, in stores and reading lots of reviews at various sites like Amazon, CNet etc. I bought this TV and got it 10 days ago.A lot has been covered in the reviews here, so i will try to focus on some other points.Summary: Buy it now and from Amazon and save money.Pros:- Excellent picture quality...really superb. Beats LG & Sony for sure. There are several different modes for viewing.- Great sound. There are modes like movie, normal, music etc which are really very impressive. I decided to buy a home theater system later, since the TV itself has made a good impact on my pocket.- Amazon delivery. Very good and timely. Came on specified date and time by CEVA. Guy opened it up connected the cable and scanned the channels and let me check for working condition.- Not very heavy, so easy to mount yourself.- Tilt wheel remote..a bit tricky initially, but you will love it once you get used to it.- Contrast is excellent due toits highest contrast ratio in all the TVs in market. Check my pictures for detail.- Warranty : Samsung provides 1 year in-home care warranty for this TV. If you register it online, you get 3 months of extended warranty free.You can buy 3 years extended warranty either through Amazon (in first 60 days of purchase) or directly from Samsung (in fist 11 months of purchase). There is a significant price difference.- USB port is good and it is so easy to view pictures or movie files.  I connected my iPod (after enabling disc usage in iTunes) and it works  perfect with the TV.I am using a Monster Power Center to feed the power to TV, DVD & cable box and also for the cable signal to my cable box. It is said that it improves the picture quality esp in HD.I have mounted this TV on Bell'O FP-4850HG High Gloss Black Flat Panel Mounting System.(Read my review on the mounting system too)So far, I have not been able to take it online either with wireless or Ethernet (LAN) connection. The Wireless Key from Samsung is on nation-wide back order and TV couldn't detect my LAN settings. Need to figure this one out yet.Some people have reported issues with RED Touch of Color and reflection. I don't see these as an issue. My TV is facing a big window and I put blinds down, if reflection gives a viewing problem. However, its not that huge. You can strategically place your TV to avoid that. And I have not observed any reflection issues from floor lamps or ceiling lights.

Reviews.Title: Solid TV with a few flaws
Reviews.Author: Jian Qiu
Reviews.Content: I won't repeat the praises of the TV quality of what others said, as I agree with most of them and don't need to repeat what is already said a dozen times.  Now onto aspects that might affect buyers' decision.DLNA:I did a ton of research and find the lack of information on this feature so thought I would write a review mainly on this feature.  This was the selling point why I chose this model over the 46A650.  It was a mistake.  This model present two options of video playback -- through USB and DLNA, both which failed horribly, in my opinion, because it isn't practical due to lack of codec support.The DLNA server software included with the TV is very, very slow.  I mean it!  It feels as if the software has to warm-up before it can perform the function, for example opening a folder takes about 7 seconds.  The folder had no files.  That's a pretty badly written software, you feel as you are beta-testing the software.  You can use other DLNA software such as TwonkyMedia, which is MUCH faster, to fill in the bridge but you'll run into another issue: "This codec is not supported", which means, for those not too computer savvy, basically means I can't play this files with this type of compression (note: compression type is not the same as file extension.).  Then reading the manual you will also noticed that each codec it supports has a maximum resolution of a certain size, else if the file movies exceed the resolution, it will spit out another error message: "Resolution is not supported".  Hopefully down the road Samsung will issue a firmware to add more codec support (MKV, RM, OGM, FLAC, WMV, and many others currently not supported!)  Another alternative is wait for DLNA server softwares to add support for this TV series using transcoders, similar to how TVersity re-encodes files the PS3 cannot read to codec formats the PS3 can read right before before streaming it into the PS3.  However, USB built-in video support won't ever be practical without a firmware upgrade...But, in the meantime, the feature isn't worth taking up valuable ports in my 4 port router.  Hook up your computer to your TV if you have the option, as that is still the best way to get all your movies to play.Despite all the negatives, I highly recommend this TV.  This TV deserves all the praises it gets from all other reviewers; however, don't expect it to be much different from the 46A750 in regards to feature due to the limitations.  If your decision on this set lies solely on the DLNA, pass on this and grab a 46A650 and save yourself the premium you are being charged for a broken feature.  Do note this set has built-in woofers that the 46A650 does not have.  The built-in woofer was adequate for my needs.Update:I've encountered another issue: Touch of Color peeling.  The Touch of Color peeling is when the touch of red around the TV starts to peel, revealing the color silver in my case.  This is very disturbing...Can't update my review but to me the TV is about a 3.  All the 750 potentially can have this issue so be warn if you buy this.  Mines did not appear till 1 month later.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding all around!
Reviews.Author: mlkri
Reviews.Content: This Samsung LN46A750 is outstanding! We are amazed at the picture. (We stepped up from a 46" 780p DLP to this 1080p LCD) We have not been able to test it's full function at 120hz since we don't have blu-ray but with all HD sources we've tried (Directv HD, Upconverted DVDs, and XBOX 360 on 1080p) the picture is just spectacular.We were concerned about the red color around the edge, but we find that it isn't really a factor for us either way. It sort of looks like a glass top table edge with the red just inside the edge all the way around.The other issue we were concerned about from all the reviews is the glossy screen finish. This absolutely makes the picture seem sharper and the contrast higher. We have a room with many windows (not the prime setting during the daytime for screen placement but not much choice for us)  and while you can see reflections with the screen off, once it is on it doesn't seem to be any problem. In very dark shots you might see a reflection during daylight due to windows but it isn't something that bothers us at all. In fact I really have to look for it. As for glare surprisingly this screen is much better than our DLP was. Glare isn't a problem at all for us.Highly Recommend this HDTV.

Reviews.Title: Great TV with a Major Design Flaw
Reviews.Author: Sgp
Reviews.Content: Samsung LN46A750 46-Inch 1080p DLNA LCD HDTV with RED Touch of ColorWithout a question this is a great TV.However a significant major design flaw is very distracting.The edge is a 3/8" thick x 3" glass frame and light is transmitted from the inside out through the glass (edge piece). Imagine seeing an aura around the TV on the outside edge where there is clear 1/4" clear class bezel. I have proven this being the problem by masking the inside edge with black electrical tape, which blocks the light transmission.I which I could attach some pictures. I placed a service call with Samsung and pictures were sent to them. There response was that this effect was by design. Indeed flawly designed. This effect is more pronounced at night or in a dark room, or when located in an entertainment center.

Reviews.Title: Wow, great TV!
Reviews.Author: Slowestrider
Reviews.Content: Wow! Look at that picture. That is what I have been saying in the last 10 days whenever I watch TV, DVD or Blu-ray.After many visits and online browsing, I was sure my next TV would be a Samsung. Sony was my brand of choice for TV for many years. I chose Samsung for picture quality and value. I was almost sure on the 46A650 until the price gap dropped to less than $100.00 and a chance to view both TV side by side on the same material at my local store. Despite many stated the different between 650 and 750 are extra woofer, saved materials in the 1GB and USB video capability on the 750, I noticed brighter picture, more contrast and more neutral coloring on the 750 compared to the 650. I am assuming both TVs had factory default setting, as in most large retail stores.Let's get the imperfection out of the way first but those are minor and not deciding factors for most.Yes, my TV was manufactured on 08/2008 and the "halo effect" is there. I noticed that even on a brightly lighted store. I have read on this and other sites stating Samsung is aware of this issue and fixes are in order. The halo doesn't really bother me. The clarity, life like quality of this TV won all my attention that I don't even notice the halo even at night with all light turn off. Samsung is great in customer service. I have already contacted service and a tech is going to come to my house to replace the bezel once he got the part. Even with the current bezel, I am still a happy customer.Yes, it would be nice to have the swivel base as on the 650 but this TV is so light that I can easily move it aside when I needed to connect or disconnect from the back.The transparency of this TV also may be mistakenly to be its' weakness. I noticed video signal trailing the audio signal (lip-synch) on a couple DVD but not HD or analog TV program. I contacted OPPO and found out there is a firmware update for that player. After installed the latest firmware, the issue went away. Others have reported audio signal trailing video signal. But I wonder if it is due to the other associates equipments. This TV is so transparent; it truly reproduces what feeds into it.Here are the good parts.Sounding of this TV is top notch. Of cause it cannot compares to any half decent home theater system but it beat out my two channel stereo speaker. When I first hooked up the Samsung Blue Ray BP1500, I assumed it would default to 5.1 audio with the optical connection as with Yamaha DVD and OPPO players. I end up watched Iron Man with TV speakers. After help from member of AVSFORUM, I found out the setting for sound and video on that player.Picture quality is absolutely breath taking. It is like an excellent, well set up Hi-End two channels audio system. You can hear, in this case, see the depth, color, and detail so vividly, life like. Before I received Blu-ray discs, I was watching old DVD, original and back up copies with my OPPO player. All the movies were like watching the first time since I have never seen such outstanding picture quality. (I have Sony rear projection LCD and watched many times on my brothers' Philips and Mitsubishi 1080 LCD) I couldn't detect the big different between the back up and original DVD on the OPPO. It would partially due to the edge enhancement of the Faroudja's Directional Correlational Deinterlacing processing. The OPPO player would smooth out edges and enhance imperfection on DVD. Not so the BP1500. With the BP1500, a poorly recorded DVD would clearly detect on 24Fs setting but not on lower setting. With back up DVD, I actually prefer watching the good old OPPO player but the BP1500 would provide much better 3D like image and higher contrast and detail pictures with original DVD and Blu-ray discs. BP1500 is a good match and a winner from Samsung.I am so happy with the TV. The choice on 750 over the 650 is validated again when guests and family members enjoyed those preinstalled programs on the content section. The sounding of the 750 over the 650 is easily worth the extra $50+ I would save if I purchased the 650. I haven't had a chance to use the USB or the DLNA yet.The new 850 is thinner and the 950 is surely more advance. I don't even want to check spec and watching those TV since I just can't dump another few thousands to upgrade associated equipments.With the current pricing and value provided by this 750, I would buy another one if any TV in my house needed replacement.

Reviews.Title: Samsung A750 Series TV
Reviews.Author: quadcomm
Reviews.Content: All the great things said about this TV are already covered in many reviews so I won't repeat them.- I have the TV mounted above my fireplace, 5' 6" off the ground. I can still see the "Halo" effect but it does not bother my wife and I. We don't really notice it while watching a movie.- Navigating the TV's menu is touchy with the remote. Sometimes when I press a button to move to the next menu item, it'll skip to the 3rd menu item.- Some reviews state that the remote looks and feels cheap. I disagree; it looks pretty solid to to me.- The higher Auto Motion Plus (AMP) is set to, the more fuzziness we notice on some edges (e.g. the outline of a person's head moving against a background). We notice this 20% of the time while watching a movie (Blu Ray with full 1080p). Also, AMP seems a bit inconsistent; the movie will be totally smooth for a few seconds, and then it's slightly choppy next (as if AMP was turned off). I noticed this on the previous Samsung 71F HDTV model too, but this A750 model is a bit better. AMP has not fully matured but it's pretty damn good and we still use it. After watching this TV for a while with AMP on, all other TVs without the frame interpolation feature look like slideshows!- Cartoon and animated movies look AMAZING with AMP set on High. The Lion King regular DVD blew me away. Worlds different than a SD television. I could have almost mistaken the movie for a Blu Ray (using a 1080p upconverting DVD player helps).- I am confident that this is the best LCD you can buy today (this review was written August 2008). On May 2008 a professional ISF calibrator wrote:"I had a chance to work on one of these displays yesterday.The results were very impressive post calibration. The color performance was very close to a Pioneer Elite plasma. The following report shows the measurements. This is definitely the best LCD I have worked on to date."If you Google that quote you will find a link to his PDF calibration report if you want real technical info.- Plasmas inherently have deeper blacks (the contrast ratio numbers are not accurate from any HDTV manufacturer) but I chose this LCD for the following reasons:  1. It's lighter.  2. It consumes less power.  3. The hardcore videophiles at avsforum still use burn-in discs to break-in their new Plasmas. Today's plasmas do not require as much break-in, but people still take precautions. I wouldn't want this nagging thought in the back of my head.  4. The black levels are already very deep in this A750 LCD. I was watching a Las Vegas cityscape scene in a movie, which is ideal for demonstrating contrast performance; ultra-bright white lights against a black night sky. Very nice in this A750.. not as deep as 2009's or 2010's OLED TVs, but still very good.- My TV randomly shut-off (with a loud thud from the subwoofers that woke up my sleeping daughter), which was very annoying, but a firmware update solved the problem. You need a USB thumb drive and you can download the firmware to it from Samsung's site. Plug the USB thumb drive in the TV and commence the update. It's very easy. I also noticed better colours (more natural and vivid) in movies with the firmware upgrade.- One reason I chose the A750 model over the A650 is the integrated subwoofer. I wanted a 'complete' sound system without having to invest in external speakers or subwoofers that will add clutter to my living room. As far as sound quality goes, A750's system is good for the casual movie watcher. The integrated subwoofer produces plenty of bass.- ATTN Canadians: I am from Vancouver, B.C. and I ordered this TV on this website and had it shipped (for free) to Blaine, Washington, just 2 minutes south of the US border. Within 1 hour I drove down to pick up the TV and I returned home. I only had to pay PST + GST. No US taxes on amazon.com. Beware that you may be asked to pay 5% duty. Regardless it's a heck of a lot cheaper than buying a TV in Canada; I saved around $1,100!===== Update August 14 2008- The "Touch of Color" (ToC) bezel isn't a bright red like some product photos may lead you to believe. None of my friends or families who saw the TV mentioned the red color. I pointed out the ToC to them and for the most part they responded "Oh!" So if you're worried about ToC being distracting or tacky in your room, don't.- The TV itself is slow at switching between video/audio sources, i.e. switching from Playstation 3 (HDMI) to a Nintendo Wii (Component) or Apple TV (HDMI) seems to take 10 seconds to complete (I haven't timed it). The screen just blacks out while switching and "waits" for a signal. My older tube TV was much faster at switching and I know that some HDTVs are faster than this Samsung but it doesn't bother me.- If you want to see AMP's flaws, watch one of the early scenes of a wolf chasing a caribou in Planet Earth. You'll see the caribou shake violently in some parts of the chase because AMP can't figure how to frame interpolate properly. Another good scene that exposes AMP's flaws is the Golden Eagle attacking a bird, in episode 'Mountain'. Turn down the AMP setting from 'High' to 'Low' and it's much better. Personally we leave it at 'Medium' or 'High' because we think the benefits still outweigh the cons.===== Update July 14 2009- The novelty of AMP wore off and we don't leave it on High anymore. The well-known Soap Opera effect (too smooth a motion picture) is a bit annoying. We leave AMP on Low or Medium now. The frame interpolation feature is still worth it, though, especially for animated movies. If I buy another TV I will make sure that it has frame interpolation.- I still love the TV. There are newer & more advanced TV sets out today, but this one still displays a great picture. The colours still pop.

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Gary D. Chamberlain
Reviews.Content: I have had my tv now for about a month. When I connected it up and turned it on I couldn't believe the picture I was getting. I have basic cable and I use an outside antenna along with it so I can get the local channels in High Def. I was disappointed in one thing, the advertisement stated it had two RF inputs, so I am thinking yes one for cable and one for antenna.  Well when the set arrived it only had one input. I was pi--ed. Contacted Amazon by email and told them the situation and they agreed with me and gave me the choice to send back or they would give me some cash back. I could not see sending the set back because other than that the set worked absolutley wonderful. I settled with some cash back.  Also the ad states that you should get the white glove treatment with this set but I think that only pertains to people who live in a big city, my son and daughter bought the same set and they got the white glove treatment and I had to help carry the set into my house and uncrate and set it up myself.(Which was no big Deal) Butttt white gloove should be white glove no matter what.  I also ended up buying a remote controlled A-B switch to make my duel input work.  All in all the tv is awsome.

Reviews.Title: Stunning TV
Reviews.Author: D. Clarke
Reviews.Content: First of all let me state that I moved my 40-inch SAMSUNG 720P TV up to the bedroom - a good set that introduced me to HDTV.  The LN46A750, however, is a stunning TV watching experience compared to the 40-incher.  Rarely do I use profanity in a positive way but the words "Holy S..T" just slipped out of my lips when I first laid eyes on the picture.As I annotate my experience with the LN36A750 I will try not to be repetitive of previous reviews - details as follows:Response to previous viewers:- The so-called halo effect is simply a line around the outside (top and bottom) of the glass frame that is more noticeable in the evening.  This line is the LCD picture light slipping out of the edge of the glass frame. This is not a big deal to me and has no impact on my viewing pleasure.- The TOC red line around the outside of the frame was actually surprising as it bothered a number of reviewers.  I actually thought it was a light; it is not.  It is simply a red stripe on the clear glass frame and is not at all noticeable unless there is bright light coming in from behind the TV.- Glare on screen - not an issue at all and my TV is in a well lit room during the day.Negatives:- The TV is capable of a wireless interface - this is only good if you have a CAT 5 outlet near your TV.  If not, one must go wireless.  The SAMSUNG proprietary device is severely back ordered.  It sure would be nice if this capability came with a built-in wireless function.- Sound... I have a surround sound system that does not seem completely synced with the TV sound - gives it a slight echo effect.  The TV sound alone is about as good as TV audio gets but I have it muted and use my SS system exclusively.Positives:Picture quality, picture quality, picture quality.  From the moment I viewed the full HD picture with the 120hz processor, I was blown away.  There are a million ways to customize the view and a great data point can be downloaded from CNET (tips, picture settings) to input a "perfect" dark room picture for the LN46A750 - it is much improved over the presets that come with the TV.  There are also three "hardened" picture settings known as "ENTERTAINMENT" that cannot be changed; kinda nice to slip over to the SPORTS setting and have a look during a baseball game - The Fenway Green Monster never looked so good.  And fast motion blurring?  What blurring?Delivery: Quick, well mannered, attention-to-detail.Price: Way better than BB or CC by hundreds = looking forward to the price dropping so I can put some more cash in my jeans with the Amazon 30-day price guarantee.Frame... or bezel as some folks call it is sleek and unique.Recommendation: If you are torn between a 650 and a 750 you might want to really research the issue.  For me the prices were so close it did not make a difference but if the 650 drops, you may want to give that a closer look.  As for me, I am in HDTV la-la land and watch shows I would normally not give a second thought to simply because of the stunning picture - very happy.Cheers!Dave

Reviews.Title: Major design flaw
Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: I purchased the 750 series after doing a lot of research and reading a lot of reviews.  There was some comment on the "halo effect" but I figured how bad could it be.  Before I ordered it I went to the box store to check it out but there is so much fluorescent light and action in those stores that you cannot tell.  I just had the delivery company to my house yesterday to pick up and return the TV.  Believe me I would not have gone through the hassle of returning this if I truly didnt think it ruined the set.  This is not a minor reflection or glow only in a dark room, it is like watching another picture outside of the picture.  There is action on all sides of the bezel even in daylight.  It is especially noticeable watching sports or other programs where the full screen is taken up by the picture.  I called Samsung and they put me in touch with a repair person who basically said there is nothing he can do until Samsung comes up with a fix.  He indicated he is swamped with inquires on how to fix this.  I read some stuff about putting black tape on the back side of the TV.  This will not work as the reflection appears on the front side of the bezel.  It is truly a serious design flaw and an absolute shame, because the picture quality of the set was fantastic.  The sound was great.  The features were great.  The TV has great "guts" just a terrible design.  Once the 750 gets logged in as returned, I will be ordering the 650 model.  Unfortunately from the looks of it the 800 series has the same design as the 700.  Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: After MUCH research, this TV is fantastic!
Reviews.Author: J. Hamar
Reviews.Content: I did a bunch of research on all of the different types of TVs.  The LCDs are finally at a price point and quality that they are the good buy under 50".  I headached a plasma, but the black levels on these LCDs are darn near as good.Specifically, this Samsung 46A750 is a fantastic TV.  I was going back and forth between this model, the 46A650 and the Sony 46Z4100.  I think the Samsung looked better in the stores.  I was really worried abut the glossy screen, but after looking at both the Sony and the Samsung in the store I did not think it would be a problem.  Essentially both the Sony and the Samsung reflect light, the Sony just makes them look more fuzzy.  In my house I have 4 windows across from my TV kind of diagonally and it has not been a problem.  If anything the frame is more reflective than the screen.I picked the 750 over the 650 mainly for the DLNA function and the subwoofer.  I have not used the DLNA functions because I ended up getting a PS3 which is better for that.  I have used the USB input to play MP3s and show pictures which has worked very well.  I wanted the subwoofer because I just don't have room for the TV and speakers on the stand I have.  In my opinion the sound with the TV is very good.  The Sony may be better but this is more than adequate.The picture is wonderful!  I have it hooked to Dish HD, a WII, and the PS3.  All look exceptional on this LCD!  I have yet to find anything wrong with this TV, oh the remote is a little annoying but usable.  The 120 HZ and automotion is very smooth.  I have not had this before so yet to see how well I like it.  The TOC red is not obnoxious at all.  I think it is very pleasing and does not distract.  The picture also looks good from most angles.  It is one of the best for off-angle viewing.I was close to buying the Sony because of the free blu-ray player but waited.  When Amazon had the free Samsung BD-P1500 blu-ray with purchase I went for it!  The shipping was fast and CEVA was very good.I am very glad I got the Samsung.  My TVs have always been Sony, so this is a new thing for me.  You will not be sorry if you get this LCD, it is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: Samsung TV great - delivery terrible
Reviews.Author: Roger Beck "Good Bad"
Reviews.Content: The Samsung LN46A750 is an astounding television - worth every penny.  However the delivery mechanism set up by Amazon was absolutely horrendous. I ordered it on November 20 and received it on December 4 - after it had sat in a location 8 miles from my house - then was shipped to a city 75 miles away to sit in a warehouse. (Pilot had handed it off to another trucking company).  When it was finally delivered there was no "white Glove" service and, as I said it was two weeks after the order was placed.  Absolutely dreadful delivery service...but a great TV at a good price. I guess you can't have everything.  Shame on you Amazon!!

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: N. Aravind
Reviews.Content: I have had this product for about two weeks now. I would have to say that the amazon price for this product cannot be beat by any other retailer. It took about 10 days to get the product delivered, but it was well worth it. The product was delivered with no scratches or dents and the person who delivered made sure the TV functioned right before he departed. The quality of the picture is just amazing, along with the Denon Receiver and Polk Speakers, this can't be any better. I still have trouble setting up the InfoLink stuff though, I am working on it :)

Reviews.Title: AWESOME TV AND DELIVERY SERVICE
Reviews.Author: F. Delgado
Reviews.Content: I have had this TV for a about a month so far and I just love it.  The image is perfect and it looke very nice in my living room.The delivery service from CEVA was also excellent. They called me to set up a delivery date, and informed me about the 4hour window. After I asked for a more precise time for delivery, they called the truck driver to find out where he was. The driver ended up calling me from his cell to let me know when he was going to deliver it. Very nice. Two guys delivered, unpacked and plugged it to the outlet. They were very friendly and nice. They even gave me some tips on some of the TV features. Couldn't be any better than that.I haven't been able to see internet content (through ethernet cable)on this TV yet. It might be some mis-configuration on my router, but I haven't spent much time on it either.Flash drive worked fine on TV, showing MP3, pictures and video.I have noticed the light through the frame issue that some people complained about, but it doesn't bother me and I kind of like the frame. It is only when the room is completely dark. It is actually a 45-degree angle surface that reflects the image from the screen on the outer frame. (Anyways, it doesn't bother me...)As always, Amazon is a very good place to buy and I would highly recommend Amazon and CEVA.!!!!I saved about $800 on this purchase when comparing it to Best Buy...

Reviews.Title: Best TV out There
Reviews.Author: gob0go
Reviews.Content: I'm not going to repeat what the other great reviews out there say, nor am I going to bash any other LCD TV's on the market that other people say look better or just as good as this TV.  All I'm going to say is that before you make your purchase, go to a store that sells this set and look at the picture quality yourself.  I was looking at three different TV's since January of 2008 and decided on this one because it looked the best in my opinion.  I was really headed toward going for the new LED technology in the 4081 then looked at the Sony XBR's but decided to go with this one because it gave me more bang for the Buck.  I looked at the 650 but couldn't stand the way the bezel looked and the 750 bezel looked so much more pleasing to my eye.I know a number of people out there complain about some "halo" effect when looking at the TV at night but I have yet to see it on my set.  A number of other people have complained about not having the Wireless adapter that you can order from Samsung but is out of stock...Well my co-worker recieved one for free in the mail without even inquiring about it after he registered his TV.  He purchased two TV's and I don't know if thats the reason why he received the adapter for free or not, but I hope they send me one also, if not, that's fine because I have my TV located right next to my router.In closing...I love my TV, it's color, bezel and more than anything else it's Picture which is more important to me than anything else.  Like I said earlier in my review, go to a store and compare the image of the TV's carefully then make your decision on what you like the most.  If it's something else then go for it, but I'm telling you you cannot go wrong with this set.

Reviews.Title: Gorgeous
Reviews.Author: Jeremy Palmer "Amazon Customer"
Reviews.Content: I spent a great deal of time researching flat panels.  This seemed to be  the best of the bunch.  After standing in Best Buy for 2 hours looking at pictures side by side and talking with a sales rep, this was confirmed.  Amazon's price was $600 less.  The "white glove" delivery guys were great, set everything up without a problem.  The picture is breathtaking.  I say this having had a Sony wega w/ HD for the last 3 years. Picture quality is unbelievable.  The sound from the TV is also fantastic.  The biggest complaint I read about this unit before buying was the "touch of red" around the bezel and how distracting it was.  You can barely even tell it's there, so I don't know what these people are talking about.  I highly recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: Awesome HDTV - Highly recommended
Reviews.Author: Jeff J. Barczewski
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing HDTV, blows away everything out there and is competitively priced. The picture is truly stunning! We have the 46" model and the picture is so vivid and large that my wife was wanting to back up further in the room (though she has gotten use to it now).We normally don't watch the news or nighttime shows but when turning on a 1080 high def channel, it's hard to turn it off since the picture and colors are just so good, we end up watching things we normally wouldn't just because the picture is so good.We also still watch a decent amount of standard def shows on this tv since we haven't upgraded our DVR and everything else yet, and the tv does a good job of upscaling and rendering the pictures on the large screen. We'll certainly want to get everything possible in high def in the future, but in the meantime it does a great job of upscaling while we are in transition. I do not have a Blueray player yet to try out the 1080p video yet, but the 1080i from the small antenna we have is just amazing!We ordered it in time for the Olympics and are enjoying every minute of it (in 1080i). The color, sharpness are just phenomenal. The 120hz refresh and smoothing handle full motion very well. What a wonderful TV!Some people in the forums have mentioned a problem with a little glare around the edge of the tv (reflection on the exterior edge of the glass frame), but honestly it isn't a problem for us. We currently have the tv on its stand at eye level (without tilting down which would get rid of issue) and it's almost not even noticeable, certainly not anything we'd complain about.The extra features of this model over last years include being able to watch video (in addition to photos and music) off the usb port or via the network (using software on your pc). We haven't tried sharing from the pc yet (but plan to), the display off the usb works great. We've already taken photos and videos from our cameras, copied to usb flash drive and plugged into tv for instant slide shows and movie viewing.This model also has additional content like built in slide shows, cooking recipes, and workout content. The built in slideshows are wonderful having some Monet artwork and some awesome landscape photographs with accompanying music. It's just beautiful and the content can potentially be updated from Samsung (according to the manual). This is just a start of what could be done with content for this TV, I hope that Samsung and/others will continue to make more for it. It even has some stories, songs, and games for the kids.It also can instantly fetch the weather, stock prices, and blog news entries (complete with photos) and display on the screen over what you are watching. This works great for checking the weather, news, stocks, etc. while waiting for a show to come back on.Built in sound is pretty good, many people will probably go with a receiver to handle the sound, but the in the box speakers and subwoofer do a decent job for us.Amazon white glove delivery was great! No problems with tv, they set it up and helped us check that it was undamaged and was acceptable before they left. We had no dead pixels and it was in perfect condition.We researched and checked out many models and other brands before choosing this tv and as for right now, I believe this is not only the best value HDTV for this size, I have not seen any TV that is better in terms of picture quality, contrast, sharpness, etc. The forums are full of other happy customers like me which all had similar reports. I would highly recommend this LCD HDTV!!!

Reviews.Title: Beautiful!
Reviews.Author: Nan "Dotty Mama"
Reviews.Content: We LOVE our new TV, and we haven't even gotten HD cable yet.  It looks much better than we expected.  We've been enjoying the Olympics, especially the opening ceremonies.For those of you who wonder, the red on the frame isn't all that noticeable, not obtrusive at all.We like the artwork that you can display, and want to explore the children's built-in programming when our grandson comes to visit.  We also like that we have the biggest digital photo frame on the block.This was a long-awaited and much-researched purchase.  We got the best TV we could afford.  Despite popular opinion, bigger is not necessarily better for flat-screen TV's.  My husband wanted to get a 55-inch TV, while I figured a 42-inch would be about right.  We compromised on the 46 inch.  He now admits that any larger would have been too big, and the 46 inch is nearly too big.  That's as close as I'm going to get to a "you were right, I was wr-wr-wr-wrong."

Reviews.Title: Great picture, service issue
Reviews.Author: Zapfi1966
Reviews.Content: I have been very happy with this TV. Great picture, glare not an issue for me, easy setup, good sound and plenty of connectivity. What made the difference for me when comparing to Sony XBR or some others was the fine resolution of the picture. Some of the other LCDs even Plasmas looked "grainy", not this TV, it looks almost like a Tube. Also, I have not seen any motion-related blur (even with Automotion 120HZ at "low"). I can only hope that more channels at Time Warner go to HD because this is very the TV obviously really shines. SD is ok as well but I guess that's not why we all bought it. I use a Playstation 3 for Blue-ray. Awesome.I gave the TV a 5 Star because it's great. However, the delivery service sucked. The "White Glove" firm lost my set (somewhere between Hoboken and Long Island). On top they were not helpful and rude. After 2.5 weeks I canceled my order and bought at Datavision for the same price.The other thing people have to remember is that LCDs lose color and contrast when you don't sit right in front of it. It's kind of nagging me a bit. Not sure if this is worse than for other LCDs or not. Nevertheless, great TV for the price.

Reviews.Title: Big, bold, and beautiful television.
Reviews.Author: Robert A. Morin "Midwest Home Media Technolog...
Reviews.Content: First off, let's say, there were two guys from CEVA that brought this to me just yesterday, and has provided me with almost 4 feet of glory right to my back porch.  Right now, I have this hooked up to my cable feed, and am running QAM and standard 0 - 75 (will be doing a formal hook-up this weekend with other components of mine).  So far, I can't even begin to tell you how accurate this picture is, using the settings from an online reviewer, this is almost on par with a comparable plasma, colors are very natural, the motion hardly blurs, and the size really does bring that to almost lifelike proportions.  Also, for a high-end LCD, this does have some of the best sound qualities that I've heard out of anything we own.  This is unheard of for Samsung to have this good of sound.Setup was very easy, got a chance to configure this using Cnet's settings, in Movie Mode, with all the tweaks that they provided.  Even during the day, this has some good effect to the black levels, the color accuracy, and everything else.Originally, I was considering going with a Sony Z4100 or XBR6, but just couldn't justify that price tag that they had.  I'm glad that I finally determined that this was the better set for the price.  I am looking forward to seeing what else I can do with this set.  Other components I may put on here are a cable box, PlayStation 3, Toshiba DVD Recorder, Yamaha A/V Receiver with JBL Speaker System, HTPC (self built config), possibly a Wii, and an Xbox 360 Premium.  Until then, I'll definitely be enjoying using this as a television.  For my first 46", this is most certainly the best that can be had, bar none.  Best bang for the buck.Sorry for the editing, but after upgrading the firmware to 1009.1, I now notice that the component input for the Xbox 360 just doesn't seem to support the display anymore, regardless of how I set the console up.  I own a first-gen Premium console, and now am forced to look into a VGA setup, or trade this in and go for an Xbox Elite just to get a console that this set can support.I still admit, for an LCD, the black levels on this can really rival that of a plasma, albeit not quite as deep as a Pioneer, but pretty darn close.  The color palette is unheard of for an LCD, it's deadly accurate and captures more detail than I expected.  I still have yet to play a Blu-ray movie on my PS3 on here, and I'll tell you how Blu-ray performance is on this over the weekend...

Reviews.Title: WOW!---Phenomenal picture
Reviews.Author: R. Brandwein "cathparuss"
Reviews.Content: As this was my first HDTV, I did MONTHS of research prior to purchasing.  I finally decided on this product, despite mention of the "HALO" design flaw.This TV has it all, for one great price!!4 HDMI (most have 3), 120Hz (most LCD 60Hz), 50000:1 contrast ratio (most 25000:1).I've had the TV for 3 weeks, & waited that long prior to this review.EXCELLENT PICTURE. Colors are vivid, 120hz refresh rate great for sports. (Home run derby & all star game look phenomenal)My other relatives have plasmas & after seeing this TV, they are now convinced about the quality of LCDs.  They were greatly impressed.I feel menus are easy to navigate & are intuitive. Remote functions well, & is intuitive as well, although the scroll wheel design should be eliminated.In terms of the "Halo" effect. (read prior 3 star review).  A minor issue, only in dark/pitch black conditions.  I had to mention it to my wife while watching in a dark room, or else she would not have noticed it.Overall, The picture quality is unbelievable!! Which should be the PRIMARY decision when looking at an HDTV!

Reviews.Title: Everything I hoped for
Reviews.Author: CBidwill
Reviews.Content: I've had this for almost a week now and am very satisfied.  The auto-motion makes everything, including SD, look much more real, although when set to high it looks a little unnatural (unless you're watching something like Shrek or Nemo).  The Low auto-motion setting seems to work the best.  I also really liked the deep-blacks you can get from this TV.The red aura has a cool, subtle look when the TV is off (much nicer than the 650 model in my opinion).  When the TV is on you won't notice it.My one fear was realized however.  The combination of a glossy screen and deeper blacks does cause glare problems in my very windowed living room.  It's only distracting in dark sections of the screen and is no worse than my tube was, but I'm sure the less glossy, comparable LCDs from Sony would cause less glare.  But when even with this minor flaw I still have to give this a 5-star rating.

Reviews.Title: WOW!!! All I can say is WOW....
Reviews.Author: D. Fells "DNF"
Reviews.Content: This is the best purchase I have made in a long time!Every review you read about this Samsung LCD HDTV is 5 Stars and they are all right on the money!Every time I turn this thing onto an HD channel I just stare at it with a huge grin on my face. I love it. Amazon gave me the best price with the best service too. WOW!!!

Reviews.Title: Great TV, poor design
Reviews.Author: Brian
Reviews.Content: Firstly, the picture quality and sound quality are excellent.  It is the best seen to date.  Why did I return this TV and buy a 6-series? This TV is the exact same TV as the 650 series with the addition of a hard drive, a third speaker, a non-swiveling stand and a glass beveled frame.The swiveling stand isn't a deal breaker, but I can't understand why they wouldn't include this if it is on the 6-series already?  The glass-beveled frame was a purely aesthetic addition and it is a HUGE flaw.  When you watch this TV in a dark room, the picture from the TV will light up that frame and it is like watching the TV with a bright halo around it and it is very distracting.  In a bright room it is not as noticeable- but for me the addition of a hard drive and 3rd speaker didn't outweigh the better viewing quality and swiveling stand.Pros: Great picture, great sound, neat feautresCons: Non-swiveling stand, glass-beveled frame detracts from pictureBased on pro vs cons, go with the 6 series.  Same picture, slightly lower quality sound, better features and a better performing television.  All-in-all you cant go wrong with either of these TVs.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy Samsung product
Reviews.Author: Kguy "Kguy"
Reviews.Content: I bought Samsung TV LN46A750 from amazon 2 years ago. Now it died and out of warranty one year. when I called the customer support they arranged the time to come to fix it. The technician came and said that the main board was died and replaced the new one charge my wife $389.70. Actually I was not home at that time and when I came home she already paid for that. Nothing else to say. Could you believe a TV's life just 2 years and the main board died?!! So I want to everyone know what you will face in the future. To me, Samsung product is no more in my house, especially Samsung TV.

Reviews.Title: This TV will break and Samsung will not fix it.  ZERO STARS
Reviews.Author: Alana
Reviews.Content: My TV went into the "on-off cycle of death" after 2 years and 3 months of owning it.  I called Samsung, they said they would fix it if I had it less than 2 years, but because it was 3 months over the 2 year time period, I was on my own. >$500 to fix. Will never buy Samsung again. Period.

Reviews.Title: Product has a 2 year lifespan.  do not buy
Reviews.Author: C.B. "Cathy"
Reviews.Content: I bought this unit in September,  2008.  It is now September, 2010.  Power supply is fried,  unit will not turn on.  Other pieces of equipment plugged into same source are fine.  Web research indicates this is a known Samsung issue and that they are notorious for bad power supplies.  I paid 1500.00 for a TV which I used for 2 years.  It will probably cost me another 300 to repair.  Will never buy another Samsung unit again.

Reviews.Title: Power Board Failure- Don't Buy Samsung TV's
Reviews.Author: Robert Archacki
Reviews.Content: Purchased in April 2009 and in August 2010, four mo's after warranty I began experiencing power up problems. On power up the unit would click then the power-up tone would sound, but would not turn on. It continued to cycle through power-up cycle to no avail. Went on-line and checked several blogs, forums, and Consumer Reports and found that this is an on going problem with several Samsung  LCD HD TV's.I found out that Samsung has known about faulty capacitors on their power supply board, but hasn't publicly admitted it or addressed in an across the board recall. The cost to the consumer for the repair is typically in the range of $500.00 but the actual cost for the capacitors is less that $20.00.DO NOT BUY ANY SAMSUNG TV'S UNTIL THEY PUBLICLY ADMIT THE FAILURE AND OFFER A FIX AND AN EXTENDED WARRANTY FOR THE POWER SUPPLY BOARD.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding
Reviews.Author: Mary Contrary "bunglebee"
Reviews.Content: Our new 46" LCD HDTV is our third Samsung purchased within the past 2 years.  We also have a 40" and a 19" all purchased thru Amazon, and are completely satisfied with all.  Their clarity is superb, sound is clear.I would also like to add that the delivery service for my area, CEVA, is excellent.  Both times service was professional and cordial and I appreciate their helpfulness.

Reviews.Title: Just Got My TV
Reviews.Author: Robert Elliott
Reviews.Content: I just received my 750.  I am truly impressed with the TV and found the free delivery company (CEVA) to be great.  I made a mistake and didn't include my phone number, when I called customer service (CEVA's) I immediatly spoke with a person in my state who actually had my file.  Delivery person "Wayne" was professional and extremely nice.  He spent several minutes helping me set the tv up.  How refreshing to have such a positive experience.

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN46A750 vs. Sharp Aquos LC-46SE94U
Reviews.Author: Jonathan Orich
Reviews.Content: I did months of research before purchasing this TV.  It came down to this model and the Sharp Aquos special edition.  (LC-46SE94U).On paper they're very similar products both with different advantages.  Samsung has an extra HDMI port while Sharp has free internet diagnosis. (hook your tv up to the internet and Sharp can fix your tv remotely if anything ever went wrong with it.)On paper I was sold on Sharp.  But then I went and looked at the tvs in person to check picture quality. The Sharp didn't even compare to the Samsung.  I changed the settings to make sure they weren't trying to sell one over the other. (I'm skeptical about retail stores) This Samsung has a picture quality like no other LCD.  The blacks are as deep as plasmas. There can an issue with glare because of the glass over the screen... but if you're smart about where you place your tv in relation to your windows... this is not an issue.Now this is the best part everyone needs to know... because I didn't realize it until someone told me.  Amazon.com has a 30-day post-order price guarantee.  I purchased this tv for $2,074 and within 30 days it dropped down to $1,824.  I saved $250 after I bought this tv!!!  Amazon was very helpful and didn't mind at all that I emailed them every day the price dropped asking to refund the difference to my credit card.  (you obviously have to contact them each time it drops, they won't do it automatically)  Just make sure you buy it from Amazon.com and not one of the sellers they sometimes promote because they won't honor the guarantee.You simply cannot go wrong with this TV.  Go check it out for yourself at your local electronic store and come back home and order it from Amazon.com and save $$$.

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN46A750
Reviews.Author: R. Ness
Reviews.Content: I've had the Samsung LN46A750 for several weeks and am amaazed at the picture quality. While researching the various models the obvious choices for the best quality set was either the Samsung LN46A750 or Sony's XBR4, I debated  between these two sets for several months. I have no regrets with choosing the Samsung and saved several hundred dollars.

Reviews.Title: great purchase with only two very minor flaws...
Reviews.Author: Christos "Christos"
Reviews.Content: Wow.  This is my first purchase of a flat screen tv and I am blown away!  I did a lot of research on others and settled on this, and I'm very pleased.First off, several have mentioned the red color around the edge... not to worry, its looks very, very nice.  Samsung has done a great job of taking a every day product and turned it into a work of art.The picture quality is excellent, there are plenty of dvi inputs; I have no problem hooking up my AppleTV, PS3 & Direct TV box.I bought a few blue ray movies (play them in my PS3) and they are amazing!  I cant imagine the quality getting better than blue-ray, but who knows.  The PS3 games look equally amazing as well, if you play games you'll be blown away playing on this tv.The only two things that I don't like about the tv  are the remote.  Its been mentioned here the remote is a little funky, and it is.  They tried to implement a iPod style click wheel, but to be honest its pretty lame.  The other (also mentioned here) is the white edge the light reflects thru, its not that bad, but I cant help imagine how much better it would look without it.Now let me be clear... neither of these are deal breakers by any means!!!!  They don't detract from the the tv itself, nor the quality of the picture, or anything that will get in the way of you enjoying a magnificent flat screen tv... enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: Outstanding Performance
Reviews.Author: Douglas C. Campbell
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had spent a great deal of time researching both plasma and LCD televisions, we finally decided on Samsung's latest models and concluded the LN46A750 best met our requirements.We are very pleased with our decision. The picture is fantastic, clear, crisp and "black is black."The 50,000:1 contrast ratio appears to give a depth to the picture, almost 3D. Don't hesitate to purchase this TV.

Reviews.Title: Beyond Spectacular!!
Reviews.Author: Pamela Van Beekum "PVB"
Reviews.Content: The product is beyond excellent, the price from Amazon amazing, the service from Amazon amazing and the white glove delivery Amazon uses was just perfect.If anyone is worried about what is described as red - don't worry about it - it is very subtle and just a very elegant touch - no one should worry about matching their decor - the red is so deep and just blends into the black and clear glass. Best way to describe it is that it is like buying beautiful blown glass and a very deep red that was almost black was in the clear glass melting into black.Other issue I read a lot about was the Halo - unless you are so overly touchy and watch the tv in complete dark and probably have some sort of easily distracted personality issues - you will never even know what someone is talking about. I looked and looked and only when the lights were completely out - if I looked for it - did I notice it and through the whole movie never noticed it again. It is simply the glass reflecting in a very dark room off the light of the screen when a very bright image is on it. The very edge of the glass frame reflects minutely if you really pay attention and look for it.

Reviews.Title: Still going strong after 3 years
Reviews.Author: TechTron
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV back in 2008 with the automated mount (moves up, down, side to side with the Samsung remote) and it has been stellar. Granted, it is located in my room and gets nowhere near as much use as my family room TV but I have nothing to complain about. The sound isn't the best in the world (and I don't care to put even a sound bar in my bedroom) but it isn't a deal killer.

Reviews.Title: Great video, but not without issues
Reviews.Author: Sparkvark111
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV over two years ago and had no problems until recently.  As far as the picture is concerned, it is a great video when it works.  In October, I began having problems with the TV taking a long time before it would turn on. You would hear the relay click and the chime and it would turn itself off and come back on and repeat several more times.  It would cycle for almost 10 times before the picture would come on.  After looking online I found out about others that had the similar problems with the capacitors on the power supply.  I opened up the set and discovered two of the 25 volt 1000 microfarad capacitors bulging on top. I also notice some discoloration on the board traces near the transformer on the side that connect to those 2 capacitors. It appears to be due to excessive heat. I replaced both capacitors myself for a just couple of bucks in less 30 minutes and it worked just fine. It seems to be a common problem with this and many other Samsung TVs.

Reviews.Title: Attractve set turned out to be junk - Samsung warranty only a year, but designed to break between 12-24 months!!
Reviews.Author: rmas1004
Reviews.Content: Like so many others I loved this television when it first arrived.  Wonderful color, vivid image and sound.  However, after 11 months the television would no longer turn on.  Fortunately for me, I was just under the 1 year warrantly and they sent a repair company to fix it.  Well, now 13 months after that I have a problem with ghostiing or double image and multiple horizontal lines across the screen.  There are many online posts of others having the same problem right around the same timeframe as myself.  Typically it starts with the power supply capacitor blowing out around the 1st year and by the second year they have the double image problems.  Some made it under the warranty and some just missed it.I called the Samsung support desk and they refuse to pay to repair it.  They will not even pay for someone to look at it.  The local repair company would like $85 just to look at it and said that it would probably be around $500 to fix it.These products are defective and the commonality of the incidence rate should convince this company to require a recall.  Their customer service beyond the 1 year warranty is awful.  Some exceptions should be made when so many people are having the same problems over the same time frame that just happens to coincide with the end of the warranty period.

Reviews.Title: Only lasted 19 months!
Reviews.Author: bekrawa
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV from Amazon 19 months ago, and like some of the other reviewers here, we were pretty satisfied with it.  Then, just like some of the other reviewers noted, it started cycling on and off, and finally stopped working altogether.  A technician came out and diagnosed a problem with the main board.  It would cost $467 to repair ($200 for the board, the rest is labor).  I've read enough reviews, now, to know that this is a common problem, and I should not throw good money after bad -- the new board is probably only good for another 19 months, and the power supply is, apparently, another weak component waiting to go bad.  It's a real shame.  At this point, there are many 46 inch class TVs on the market for $800, or less.  I'll probably buy one of those, and take the loss.

Reviews.Title: Word of caution
Reviews.Author: K. Strawn
Reviews.Content: We purchased this TV about 21 months ago.  Until recently we have been very happy with our purchase.  The picture quality is superb!  We were so happy we purchased a second Samsung TV.  However, this week we have experience a problem.  When I attempted to turn the TV on it started cycling on and off after a few minutes the picture would come up.  Today the TV started cycling again and the picture has yet to come up.  I called Samsung and they arranged to have the TV serviced, but since we did not purchase the extended warranty we are on our own to cover the costs.  I did some research on the Internet and found that this problem is not uncommon with this TV. It appears to happen within the first 2 years. At this time I don't know what the service is going to cost.  Estimates I saw reported were for around $300.  I believe that a class action lawsuit is in the works.  [...]If you purchase this TV I recommend the extended warranty.  Please understand that our family never purchases extended warranties, however, based on my experience and research I am extending these words of caution with this product.

Reviews.Title: Quit working after 13 months!!!!
Reviews.Author: Patricia Carole "patisinky"
Reviews.Content: I am so upset because the warranty is only good for one year.  The tv keeps turning itself off the second you turn it on.  I researched the internet to see what the problem could be and found a lot of customers with the exact same problem!  They said it cost between 400-500 dollars to fix and and it is caused by a bulging resistor and they replace the whole circuit panel.  Usually it is 18 months when they go out from other reviews.  I spent almost 2000.00 after shipping, etc. and it is too expensive to just throw away yet 500 dollars to fix is also ridiculous.  I should have stuck to my old reliable Sony.

Reviews.Title: Buy only if you want to pay for Audio only
Reviews.Author: william
Reviews.Content: Be forewarned, this TV is fine while it's working but the screen goes black (after about a year in my case) and so far I have not been able to determine if there is a remedy.  It looks like a common problem so even though the price is relatively low it has turned out to be a very bad value.

Reviews.Title: 10 month review. Very pleased!  DLNA works fine with PlayOn
Reviews.Author: truthplz "truthplz"
Reviews.Content: I purchased my LN46A750 from Amazon in July 2008, and it was a great decision. I have 6 devices connected to it:(1) Sony HTCT100 Sound Bar W/Sub-Woofer (connects 3 HDMI devices to tv)(2) TW Digital Cable Box (2 connections: HTCT100: HDMI SAT, TV: Component)(3) Sony Playstation3 (HTCT100: HDMI PS3)(4) JVC XVN670B upconvert 1080p DVD Player (HTCT100: HDMI DVD)(5) Dell SX-280 2.8ghz pc w/wireless keyboard (tv: HDMI/DVI)(6) ReplayTV RTV-5040 PVR 320GB (tv: component)I also purchased a Harmony One remote to control all these devices, and it does a splendid job. I have my TW digital cable box set up so that it just uses tv input for regular viewing (via component), and the option to use the nice Sony HTCT100 (via HDMI) when watching movies, etc. For the PS3, I bought a PlayStation 3 Blu Wave so that the Harmony One could communicate with it.As far as the halo effect, the only time I think about it is when I read the reviews here. My LN46A750 sits about 12 feet away from me at about 45" eye level. As far as window glare is concerned, there is very little. So for me, the halo effect is a non-issue.The ethernet connectivity, along with DLNA support is great. Many people have had problems with Samsung LN46A750's DLNA capabilities, so I didn't bother trying it for myself until just recently. PlayOn has a service whereas you can watch Netflix, Amazon VOD, Hulu, CBS, YouTube and ESPN directly from your Samsung LN46A750. However, for this to work, you need a computer which is at least a dual-core 1.5ghz. I personally just use my Dell D620 2.2ghz dual-core laptop. I am using a Linksys WRT54G2 Wireless-G Broadband Router. Under router settings, make sure to enable UPnP and Filter Multi-cast. Both my Dell D620 running PlayOn and Samsung LN46A750 are connected via cat-5 cable. Also, my LN46A750 is set up to receive automatic IP address, not static.I have broken down using PlayOn into 2 steps:(1) PLAYON SET UP (2) PLAYON VIEWING.The REFERENCE section is located near bottom of this review. Actually you should read it first before installing PlayOn. Learnng PlayOn is somewhat confusing at first, but it will soon become second nature for you. It is well worth the time and effort.==========================================================================Step (1) PLAYON SET UP:Download Playon's software to your computer from [...]After installation and verifying Playon Media Server is Running (see REFERENCE section below), your computer now becomes a server to your Samsung LN46A750.==========================================================================Step (2) PLAYON VIEWING:Turn on just your LN46A750 and press the W.LINK button on the remote. You should see a WISELINK Pro menu with Photo, Music, Movie and Setup icons. Using your Samsung remote, click GO RIGHT until you reach the Movie icon. On movie icon, click the ENTER button. Sometimes it takes a second for remote command to take place on screen, so be patient.You should now see folders for Netflix, Amazon VOD, Hulu, CBS, YouTube and CNN. The folder you are currently on is larger than the ones beside it.Next, practice by accessing latest "The Academy" episode under Hulu:Click ENTER on the Hulu folder, and message "UPPER FOLDER" appears. Click GO RIGHT until you are on TV Episodes folder, then click ENTER. Again, UPPER FOLDER shows. Click GO RIGHT until you see the A Folder, and click ENTER. UPPER FOLDER shows. Then click GO RIGHT and click ENTER on The Acadamy folder. UPPER FOLDER shows. To the right you will see actual episodes (Movie camera icon). Click GO RIGHT to the first (latest) episode, and then click ENTER. Once selected, a count-down pinwheel with message "Preparing to Play" appears in righthand corner. It takes about 8-10 seconds for pinwheel to go full circle. The selected video may start within 1-3 seconds, or the pinwheel may go full-circle twice before show starts. It doesn't seem to follow any particular pattern.Okay here is where the confusion arises... the pin wheel may go full circle, either once or twice, and message "NOT SUPPORTED FILE FORMAT" appears. If this occurs, immediately press RETURN (twice) very quickly. Sometimes, it works better to click RETURN twice quickly, then once more a split second later. The object is to back up one step, so that you can re-select episode by clicking ENTER again. For whatever reason, your desired show will activate fine the second time. This happens fairly frequently, but is an easy issue to deal with.Once your ahow has finished, you can either press EXIT to return to WISELINK Pro main menu, or click RETURN a few times to return to Hulu's TV Episodes menu. Each time you click RETURN backs you up one step.TIP: You can either click GO RIGHT for latest episodes, or GO LEFT for earliest episodes. You can also use yellow button on your remote to mark several episodes so that they will be viewed consecutively.==========================================================================REFERENCE SECTION.Playon settings:To get there, either double-click on PlayOn shortcut icon on your computer desktop screen, or go to Start/Programs/Playon/PlayOn Settings. Under Playon settings you have 5 tabs, with General Settings, System Check and User Accounts being most used.Under General Settings tab, make sure Playon Media Server is Running (Green Light). If not, click the Start/Stop PlayOn server button to start service. Green light appears within 5 seconds.Under User Accounts tab, fill in your info if you have Netflix account. If you have not already done so, you should go to hulu.com/youtube.com and sign up there. Enter your hulu and youtube info under Hulu Account and YouTube Usernames, respectively. Make sure to test your account(s) by pressing Test button.Samsung remote:Navigation wheel is located in center of remote. On the outside of this wheel, you can move about by clicking GO UP/GO DOWN or GO LEFT/GO RIGHT. The button in middle of this wheel is the ENTER button (also used as Pause/Continue during PlayOn play back). The W.LINK button is located right of green MENU button, or just above RETURN button. During PlayOn viewing, correct use of RETURN and EXIT buttons is important. Use RETURN to back up one step, use the EXIT button to return to original WISELINK Pro menu.-----------------------------PS. Playon software download is free for 14 days, then a one-time $39.95 charge should you decided to keep it.

Reviews.Title: Just Delivered by CEVA
Reviews.Author: Murphy the Dog "Murph"
Reviews.Content: I just received my LCD from Amazon via CEVA, I order 22Jan09, estimated time of arrival was 2Feb09, order received 27Jan09, great service.  CEVA called me while i was getting my teeth cleaned, they gave me a 4 hour window and they arrived within the first 30 minutes of that 4 hour period.  The gentleman carried it in, un-boxed it, took the wrapping off, set it up, hooked it in tested to make sure there was Picture/Sound the remote worked, and he had me check it over for damage, initialed all the above as being done.  He asked if I wanted to keep the box or he can throw it away.  I said to take it.  (I forgot that I needed the UPC from the box for the rebate).  Luckily when he called it was on Caller ID, so I called him and left a message, he hadn't tossed the box yet and cut the UPC out and left it in my mailbox.  Awesome effort on his part as I forgot this and he went above and beyond.The TV looks great with factory settings using HDMI thru my Onkyo and Set Top Box.  I will still do a little Calibration from AVS Forum and or CNET just to see what calibration changes.I turned my PS3 on which is hooked up thru the Onkyo as well via HDMI.  No signal, arrrgh, time to get support on the phone.  Samsung was helpful enough to see if it worked going straight from PS3 to Samsung, offered to give me an option to run straight to TV and run audio to Onkyo.  I like HDMI one cable setup so I called Onkyo since it seems to be an issue with the handshake.  Got Onkyo on the phone, Tech said to reset the Onkyo to factory defaults and run thru the setup for configuring HDMI thru the video ports.  Viola, PS3 is now working thru the Onkyo.That was about the extent of my setup.  I had to get to work.  I tested a blu-ray movie it looked really good compared to my old 720p LCD.  Watched National Geo. HD on FIOS looked great.  I still need to calibrate, and test the other features of this TV for a better review, just wanted to post my first impressions of setup and delivery.  I'm glad I got it in time for the Superbowl.  Thanks Amazon and CEVA and a couple of tech support guys.

Reviews.Title: A Picture so well Defined its almost.... Surreal !!
Reviews.Author: Joe A. Zills
Reviews.Content: Like most, I did a lot of pre-holiday window shopping before making a 'big ticket' TV purchase. After seeing the Samsung LN46A750 model in a side-by-side comparisom - playing the same DVD video - with some other highly tauted brands, I was Sold! Some Blu-Ray DVDS appeared almost 3-D like on this screen. Buying this model through Amazon saved me some 'large green' and delivery was made as scheduled. "I'm Very Pleased with this Samsung product coupled with Amazon's advertising, pricing and delivery service." - JAZ

Reviews.Title: Happy
Reviews.Author: marest
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with the value of my Samsung purchase (sending in UPC for NFLShop.com $200.00 gift certificate). I registered the product on s[..] and got an additional 3mth warranty for my time.I put the TV through it's paces this weekend and it passed with flying colors. An earlier reviewer mentioned watching Football/Hockey were near religious experiences. This has to be true because I found my self watching basketball for the first time in years (tongue-in-cheek). The detail is incredible. It is like "being there".I am getting a PS3 (Thru EBAY) tomorrow and I am very excited to see how a 1080p blu-ray disc performs. My cable system sends its HD programming in 1080i. Does DishNetwork or Direct TV send signals in 1080p?I did notice some eyestrain this morning which I think is due to trying to absorb all the information/detail I am visually processing. I watched Aliens (FOXHD) last night and it was like seeing it for the first time.Sound was pretty good but I think I will get the matching 2.1 system from Samsung. I am still trying to figure out the best sound in Custom Sound mode. But it is passable "as-is".In addition, this was my first big internet purchase, but saving a couple hundred $ (& the NFL Promo) off the price of our local Best Buy was worth the trepidation/concern. I had it sent to my work. I would recomend Amazon to anyone.This is alot of TV for the money.

Reviews.Title: Unfu#%ing Believable
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: The color jumps out at you, it's so clear and has so much detail that it's hard NOT to get distracted by things like lint and patterns on clothes, blades of grass, human pores and strands of hair. Watching HD football  and hockey games are like a religions experience.This TV has ruined me. I can not watch regular TV's. I won't live without HD and love this TV more than any "toy" that I've gotten myself in decades.

Reviews.Title: New Living Room Feature!
Reviews.Author: Cody S. Davis
Reviews.Content: I love this TV. I saw it at Best Buy in a display with a Blue Ray playing After viewing the Wall-o-tv's for about 45 minutes at best buy debating between the Panasonic Viera (Plasma) and an LG (LCD) they had on display. When I walked around a corner to find this gorgeous TV by itself with a bluray playing. I made my choice and man am I happy! The delivery took a little longer than I wanted (about 2 weeks) but it was worth the wait. I bought a Sony blue ray and the quality is amazing. My next purchase will be 1080p surround sound to complete the setup.. just waiting to get done feeling the hurt from buying those two items.
