Though it is not near as bad as buying at a store (Retail 1899 * our 10% tax  = $470 in savings!)

Reviews.Title: Great TV at a great bargain!
Reviews.Author: C. Hunt
Reviews.Content: I bought the 750 from Amazon in November 2008, and I have been completely pleased with its performance.  The picture and sound are awesome.  I have not had a chance to get it networked yet, so I have not tested those features, but I didn't buy the TV for the networking ability.  I have seen some comments here and elsewhere about the "halo effect" that results from the beveled edge of the frame reflecting/refracting the image on the screen.  It is true that the bevel does reflect the image at times if you are at the right angle and in a dark room.  However, this does not affect my viewing pleasure at all.  My wife did not even notice it until I pointed it out to her.  My only regret is that I did not wait a month or so longer to purchase it, as the price has now fallen $100 since I purchased the TV.

Reviews.Title: Stunning Picture In My Home!
Reviews.Author: L. Hawthorne "Shack"
Reviews.Content: I have had this TV for 1 week now, so this is not a long-term review, but I wanted to discuss my experience with some of the issues other reviewers have identified.Before I bought this 750 I visited several electronics brick and mortar stores and thought the picture quality on this 750 was as good as the Pioneer Kuro Plasma. (I am sure experts can show how I am incorrect here but the picture qualitatively looked just as good to me!) When I got mine delivered (see delivery review at the bottom!) the picture quality was just as good as in the showroom. I am not a calibrator and tweaking TV owner. I want something that works great right out of the box and the 750's picture quality is fantastic without out adjustment. The blacks are deep, off-axis viewing is great and I have only seen some small blurring and flickering issues playing Blue Ray movies that I think a owner who fine-tunes and calibrates the settings would probably eliminate.The red TOC design is not distracting at all but it is red and you do see it - it could look bad in a room with non-red colors.I have had no issues with the halo effect many have discussed so far and I have the TV on a standard height TV cabinet in a normal room. This hasn't effected me yet. Reflections in my "normal" room also seem to be no problem.The DLNA networking capability to access your PC media through the TV is nice but I get the same functionality with my Playstation 3 and it is a blue ray player as well and it works wirelessly out of the box. The 750 requires you buy an optional attachment to join your home's wireless network. So if DLNA is the only reason you buy this TV you may want a cheaper model and a PS3 so you can play games, watch blue ray movies and access your PC wirelessly with no additional purchases required.The PIP observation of not having a second tuner, thus limiting you to watching the tuner content in the sub-window while the main picture is a blue ray, VCR, DVD or game console input, has not been an issue to me. The manual describes this as a way to watch a tuner picture while you do someething else (or vice versa); it is not to watch two channels simultaneously. This has not impacted my experience at all.The bottom line reason to buy this TV is it has a fantastic picture and it really delivers.I bought my TV from Amazon and it was delivered by "Pilot" shipping. The TV came early, the box was in super condition and the Pilot delivery people were superb, bringing the TV into my basement, checking it out, cleaning it and hauling away the trash. The delivery service (which was my biggest worry in my first $1000+ internet purchase) was the best I have ever had! Great job Amazon.

Reviews.Title: LN46A750 review
Reviews.Author: KKP
Reviews.Content: After much research decided on this model  Amazing picture! Good sound (we don't have a home theater-yet)  Didn't realize what we were missing.  Like having lasik without the cost.  Extra features are nice.(The story reading is definitely for under 5 & Artwork show is great)  The delivery was extremely professional. Brought it into our home, unpacked, programmed remote & ensured cable worked.  Told us to hold onto the box for a few weeks just in case.  It's been a little over a month - no problems.  Talked parents into purchasing one for themselves.

Reviews.Title: This is the one
Reviews.Author: RRB
Reviews.Content: If you have never bought an item that turned out better than expected, than the Samsung LN46A750 is your opportunity. Out of the box stunning quality...no really, stunning. The Touch of Color is stylish but never distracting and any screen reflection issues can be avoided with a little common sense. The built-in sound quality is good, but I did opt for a Samsung theatre system. I followed-up with a professional screen calibration and found that the brightness was toned down, which released stunningly natural colors and vividness. Set-up was painless, and since I matched the LCD with other Samsung components, the simplicity of using one controller to rule them all delivered the ease-of-use promised via Anynet+. I did experience one technical question, and using the Samsung online support I had a live operator assist me via instant messsaging right on the spot via my desktop.  Better than expected!

Reviews.Title: Simply Stunning
Reviews.Author: H. Yermish "human"
Reviews.Content: The picture on this screen is stunning, simply put. There are plenty of adjustments to tailor the image to the specific content if you want really precise control, but the presets do a really nice job. The dynamic/contrast range of this TV is incredible. The downside is you start to realize just how bad much of the standard content picture quality really is! Watching movies in HD is perfect. If the content doesn't use the full frame, it is very simple to select from several zoom options to avoid picture distortion.I experimented with the D.Link content (weather, stocks, news) overlay on the picture - this is a nice way to browse some additional content without interrupting the program you are watching. The remote is easy to work with once you take a couple of minutes to figure out the logic. (It would be nice if the remote could also control the basics of a cable box, but the Comcast remote actually works fine to control the main functions of the TV.)In the run up to purchasing this product, I looked at all of the different models that I could. In several different stores with different content, I picked the Samsung 6/7 series sets out as best. Only some of the Sony screens were as good, but the price was typically a few hundred dollars higher. You will be VERY happy with this Samsung 7 series TV.

Reviews.Title: Terrific TV
Reviews.Author: TV Geek
Reviews.Content: I researched TV's for quite awhile.  I also read these reviews and they really helped me decide on the LN46750.  The TV was delivered on time, it was unpacked and set up.  Great delivery service!! The picture is absolutely stunning.  WOW!!Some reviewers complained about glare.  My room has a whole wall of windows and my old TV (a 32 inch Toshiba) had a real problem with the glare.  Not so the Samsung.  Just a beautiful picture. And, the price was right.

Reviews.Title: What-A-Buy!!
Reviews.Author: A. Jo Vaughan
Reviews.Content: I own multiple LCD HDTVs. I had been shopping around for a 46 or 47 inch when I found the LN46A750.  The contrast ratio is excellent with the black capabilities of the higher end models.  Plenty of extras and great sound.  You can turn the 120Hz off if desired.  If you are looking for a 46 inch full-HD television with 120Hz frame rate, this one is for you! By the way, the red touch-of-color on the cabinet is not a distraction.

Reviews.Title: Awsome!!
Reviews.Author: Eziquiel Guerrero "zeke4x4"
Reviews.Content: My TV came in today and wow!! This is the most user friendly TV I have ever mess around with! It took me 2 weeks before I finally made up my mind. Amazon and the customer reviews helped me out a ton so thank you all! The screen resoulution is incredible. The first movie a had to watch was Transformers on Blu-Ray and man was that a good choice!

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey J. Fry "Fryzss"
Reviews.Content: I had the TV for two weeks when I couldn't get it to turn on. It would start to flash the red light, music would chime and the turn off. It would then recycle after about 30 seconds until I unplugged it. I called Amazon and found their dial back to work great. Got a representative within a minute or two. They asked me to call Samsung with a number they provided so I did. They set me up with a repair shop. These guys were not close and their time line was going to put me over my 30 day guarantee so I called Amazon and explained what was going on and they offered to extend my offer for a new set or money back until the repairs were done. That rocked!!The service guys replaced the main circuit board and it's been working perfect. The service guys said that they service many lines of TVs and Samsung was top dog for getting several of the TV parts to them in order to make sure it could be fixed in a single trip. So far I give Amazon and Samsung an A++. It shipped quick and I should note that the shipper can take the boxes, so I was worried about the re boxing if I had to send back. No problem, the shipper boxes it back up for you if it necessary to send the unit back.

Reviews.Title: Great picture and good features but firmware upgrade could be painful
Reviews.Author: Y. Cai "Rabbit"
Reviews.Content: Got my shipment 6 days ago, really happy with the picture, sound, DLNA, wiselink pro, infolink and build in content features. One serious problem happened to my TV when I upgraded the firmware to August 10 release.  The upgrade was successful, but all build in content disappeared.  A Samsung service tech came to my house and told me there is a microchip damaged and need to bring the TV back to their shop to repair.  It really scares me.  This is not kind of quality I expected from Samsung, and whatelse can be wrong.  Time will tell.  Anybody has similar issue?Just to follow up with my situation.  I called Amazon customer support line and described my situation.  The customer support rep. quickly placed a replacement order for me.  I received the new TV 4 days later.  They will come to pick up the old one today.  I checked Samsung web site, the August 10 firmware is no longer available.  New firmware is dated Oct. 21.  I have not seen any problem with new TV, so no upgrade is necessary.  A+ goes to Amazon's customer service.

Reviews.Title: Great TV; not-so-great remote
Reviews.Author: T. Sutton
Reviews.Content: Love this TV!  But I had a difficult time initially.  Part of it was because I had it on the wrong 'source' (the person who set it up for me did not make certain that I had a clear understanding of how to use the remote) and the picture was awful!Now, I LOVE the HD picture, but the regular (analogue) TV signal continues to look a bit fuzzy.  I'm hoping that non-HD images will improve when the all-digital broadcast change happens in February, 2009.Actually, this would have been a five star review were it not for the somewhat user-unfriendly remote.One more thing:  the Touch of Red is nice, but I don't think it adds or detracts much from the TV, one way or the other.  Perhaps in a different setting, with different lighting, it might stand out more than it does in my house.All things considered, I don't think you can go wrong with this television!  Just prepare to have a bit of a learning curve during the initial set-up.

Reviews.Title: We expected quality from this TV, but it is absolutely fantastic!
Reviews.Author: Wendy Sundquist "wquist"
Reviews.Content: We can not get anything done since it arrived last week - our eyes are glued to it!My anticipated concerns were1. the touch of color - not a problem and not even noticed2.  Stationary base - no problem. easy to adjust and move if one needs to.3. Ceva shipping - could not have been better.  With free shipping I got the TV in 4 days and they were most accomodating in meeting my time requests.  The set up includes taking it out of the box, placing it where you want it in your home, checking for physical damage and making sure sound is heard and it turns on.  The rest of the set up is up to you.  They were great.It was recommended to buy Monster HDMI 1000HD ultra-high speed HDMI cable and Monster HTS 1000 MKII or III powercenter with clean power stage 2 to receive the ultimate HD quality of the TV. So we did and they work perfectly with this tv.And for those who are remote challenged.......a logitech harmony one universal remote is a no brainer to use.We love this TV and would recommend it to those looking for a quality LCD TV. Who needs to go to the theater when you have this in your home!

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN46A750  46-Inch 1080p DLNA LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: J. Zaya
Reviews.Content: Amazon.com has done it again.  The #1 LCD HDTV, no sales tax or shipping charges, coupled with Amazon.com's "white glove" delivery, makes for a great experience.  This HDTV is the best I've seen, right out of the box.

Reviews.Title: Simply Awsome!
Reviews.Author: R. Wright
Reviews.Content: I first received my Samsung TV with the white glove treatment and was more then satisfied with that service. The gentlemen removed it from the box help my place on my table and we turned it on he gave then me a few tips truly an awsome service. Although at the time my satellite provider was unable to have my HD dish installed in time for the TVs arrival i had to wait a few weeks for that so i held off on giving my rating but even in SD this was a beautiful pitcher and the sound was great although in time i will upgrade my system to 5.1 but until then its more then good. on Aug. 11th the satellite people hooked up my HD service I went from a TV that said awsome to WOW!!! I highly recommend the samsung LN46a750 and i highly recommend it from Amazon if you truly want to save big $$$ from the reg electronic stores i saved over $600. I wont go too much into what others say about the edges on this TV there is a reflection on the bezel but it truly is not interfering with my tv enjoyment at all so i feel unless your a techno-nerd most people wont even be bothered by it.

Reviews.Title: On-Off Cycle of Death a real problem.
Reviews.Author: MPSM
Reviews.Content: I have owned this tv for 5 months, then one day I turn it off and that's it. It now turns itself on and off automatically every 10 seconds or so with no picture or sound.  I called Samsung customer service and no one could tell me what the problem is and I am stuck waiting for >3 weeks for a repair. Yeah the picture was great, but this is a known problem (on the internet) that apparently is not being fixed. Firmware updates don't work. I will never buy another Samsung product period. The customer service is horrible and the product is a big, black, expensive, and useless piece of electronics after just months. This is the first time I felt compelled to write a review on anything and would give 0 stars if I could. If you buy, get an extended warranty, preferrably not from Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN46A750 46" HDTV
Reviews.Author: DanCingD "D"
Reviews.Content: Excellent picture quality. Some reflection of light from windows or lighting fixtures during dark scenes, but I have not found it to be annoying.  I have not found a way to add titles (such as NBC, ESPN, etc.) to channel listings.  No swivel stand.  Operation of the touch wheel on the remote can be tricky at times. Overall, however, I am very pleased with the quality of this TV!

Reviews.Title: Simply Awesome!!!
Reviews.Author: Vihar Deshpande "A/V Enthusiast"
Reviews.Content: Received my new and very first 46" HDTV two weeks ago. Amazon's white glove service is good. The design & picture quality are amazing. The red touch of colour is very subtle and just blends with the design. Don't know why people make a fuss about it. It all depends on how you place the TV. As for the sound, I really don't care since all components are run through a massive receiver. Make sure to calibrate the set correctly (with reference to HD channels) and more importantly as you like and don't waste money on getting the TV professionally calibrated. Non HD channels aren't worth watching anymore.

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN46A750
Reviews.Author: Donald A. P. Bergler
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV as I felt that the technology has finally matured to the level that I would be satisfied with and I am satisfied with the 750-series. My minimum requirements for an LCD HDTV are 120 Hz frame rate, 4 ms response time, 50,000:1 dynamic contrast ratio and of course full HD (1920x1080 pixels) and this unit offers all of these. I do not have a BlueRay HD-player to see how 1080p would look, but satellite signal at 1080i looks smooth and sharp.I did not think I would require more than 2 HDMI connections, one for the signal from a surround sound receiver and another for X-box/PS3-games for my kids. But I had not decided on the SS-receiver yet. The 4 HDMI and 2 component connections proved to be very useful. My older satellite receiver only had component and S-video. I used the latter for my old setup, which on HD looks terrible. The direct connection through component input improved the image tremendously. I suspect that this unit does video signal upconverting very well. When I finally get my SS-receiver and connect to my system I will be able to compare which one does better upconverting.Unfortunately, when you switch from component to HDMI, you have to press several buttons on the remote. First where the video comes from, then the audio. Maybe if I use a different port you do not need to do this, but I ordered a Logitech Harmone 550 to eliminate the 6 remotes that I have for the 6 devices just to simplify changing devices especially for the kids and wife.The sound from the TV speakers is just great if you do not intend to purchase a surround system. But since I will be getting a 7.1 surround system, I have turned the sound off on the TV.The USB-port works great. I placed an MPG-file and one DVD-file showing Shakira's Hips Don't Lie live performance in Germany on a memory device, and it recognizes them automatically. You could easily select them to play and it plays them nicely.What I did not know was that there is a special offer from Samsung, which is not advertised anywhere, that if you buy a unit of 650 or 750 series before a certain date, you will get a wireless device to connect the TV to your network at home (DLNA) for free. This allows me to play movies at a computer on the network and display it on the TV. I found out about it at Audio Video Science Forum. I should be getting it soon. Video, I read about, may not play with MS Windows Media Player, but who uses this any ways? At least I do not as there are better media players such as PowerDVD and WinDVD on the market. Let's see if any of these works.Has the shiny screen bothered me? I have located this unit next to a huge sliding glass patio door facing north and I have not seen any annoying reflection. Maybe if I place it opposite of the door I will. The only thing that shines into my eyes is the late afternoon sun in the summer, in which case I just close the curtain.At a store, when you walk by HDTV's even LCD-units, you will notice the heat emanating from the screen. Having watched TV for a while, I do not notice the heat on this unit. Maybe if I keep it on for an entire day will I notice it, but so far, having watched 4 hours of TV in the summer, I am pleased to say that it did not add significant heat to our living room.There is many more features that will take time for me to explore. The RSS-feed is one of them when you connect it to the internet.When I bought this unit, I noticed that Amazon was selling the older model, the 650, for a hundred dollar less. It was therefore a no-brainer for me to get into this, especially since Amazon will price match a lower price. It was perfect timing since I have not seen a lower price on this unit after I bought it. I am comfortable spending about $1800 on this unit, unfortunately shipping is $150 extra. I saw a lower priced unit from a camera store in New York, but I rather go for no-hassle, customer-friendly purchase at Amazon. A lower price on this planet, BTW does not mean you will get a refund from Amazon. Buying from Amazon gives me a better peace of mind, just in case. Since I bought the unit with my Visa-card, the warranty is doubled to 2 years.I like this TV and only time will tell when it requires replacement. Let's hope when the 240 Hz frame rate and 100,000:1 contrast ratio are available.

Reviews.Title: Amazing clarity and HD experience with great sound
Reviews.Author: air90210
Reviews.Content: I upgraded from Samsung DLP 56" to this Samsung 46" LCD and the difference in HD quality is amazing. It feels like the characters are in my living room. The sound quality is also pretty amazing. The only reason for a four star instead of five is the inconvenience of changing settings. My previous DLP had one click PIP turn on/off option. The PIP only allows you to see PIP with over the air TV. With most households now having dish or cable, giving PIP for just over the air is a big miss given the fact, I had an ability to have PIP over two component devices with the DLP.

Reviews.Title: samsung tv a lemon
Reviews.Author: Bina Padalino
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV in 2008 nothing but problemsFirst power capacitors had to be replaced.Face of TV is coming lose.Half of TV screen is going black and blurry!Three years TV is out of warranty have to junk it because parts and labor cost more than new TV.Called Samsung and I ask them if they could send parts free of charge and I would pay installing laborThey would not work anything out. Basically told me sorry after only three years you're out of luck!Why would you buy a Samsung product that falls apart and stops works after warranty expires?Piece of junk!amazon also could not help.

Reviews.Title: Repair Repair Repair
Reviews.Author: tkptx
Reviews.Content: I bought this and it lasted 11 months, had to have it repaired due to no picture, $400 and then one year later same problem... then one year later same problem... for a $1500 tv it is a piece of junk.  I will never buy samsung again even though in consumer reports this was suppose to be the best tv.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY THIS SET
Reviews.Author: Ken
Reviews.Content: DO NOT BUY!!!!  I bought this set 3 years ago and have experienced the "turning on/turning off 20 times in a minute with not picture" issue that everyone else has.  The technician said it was bad capacitors, then a bad power supply, then a bad main board.  The class action suit takes care of the capacitors and power supply but you are stuck with $488 for a new main board and labor.  DO NOT BUY this TV!!!!!  It is junk and Samsung is not standing behind their product.  My cheap Vizio has lasted longer than this overpriced paperweight.

Reviews.Title: Worked great for 3 years and now a Dead Panal!
Reviews.Author: Paul James Sefick Jr.
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV in Novmeber of 2008 on Amazon, worked great until january 2012 when 2 vertical red laser like barcode strips just started showing up on the screen. Had it checked out at a tv repair shop and they told me that the screen is shot. Really?!! after only 3 years of light use in the bedroom. And the touch of color is a joke, had that replaced 2 months later after it started melting and cracking the whole tv frame, from the heat that this sucker puts out. The second toc frame thats on now did the same thing, but only took longer to show the wear about a year later. Still fighting with Samsung to do something about this issue but there giving me the run around. What i'm worried about is I just bought a new Samsung 55" 3D smart tv 7000 model in October and i'm wondering how long this one is going to last. So be careful with Samsung tv's, there great when they work.

Reviews.Title: stopped working properly
Reviews.Author: R. Bradford
Reviews.Content: It worked really well for the first two years, then unexpectedly it started having problems. The TV literally takes 30 minutes to "warm up" before it is able to be used. When I first turn the TV on it has a large black spot/streak in the middle of the screen. After about 20 minutes it switches to having lines on the left side of the screen. This usually last for about 10 minutes and then the picture is perfect again. I have tried contacting Samsung to no avail. I understand warranties and all that, but I also think that a $1500 HDTV should work well for many years. I have an old, 27 inch TV in my garage that still works. I bought that TV for my college dorm in 1998!!! There is no reason an expensive TV should stop working properly.

Reviews.Title: TV did not last after 2 years
Reviews.Author: Thomas Kong
Reviews.Content: TV worked well for about 2 years.  Then all of a sudden when I turned it on, it would play the melody, back light came on but screen went blank and after about 10 to 15 second later, the TV would reboot again.  It just kept cycling through and would not power up completely.  Not sure what happened.  This is the shortest life time for any TV I have owned.

Reviews.Title: TV rebooting / on-off issue
Reviews.Author: Rim "rimzim"
Reviews.Content: Just to warn everyone contemplating buying this tv or any other samsung tvs ( search google ). After about 6 months the tv just will not start. rather it goes into rebooting itself. You just don't have any control over the tv. It starts and you can hear the initial sound but then no display and the tv goes off in a while to start all over again. Very frustrating and annoying to happen in just 6 months. Searching google it seems this is a very common problem and Samsung doesnt have a clue as to what's happening. I have extended warranty so will update on how it goes fixing this issue. It's a warning to all spending so much money on a branded tv. Rather go with vizio or any other cheap tv so as to not waste hard earned money.Update: TV got fixed. Took 2 weeks though. Tech told me all the parts are new and warned that these are very common problems with Samsung. If you buying any Samsung, folks get extended warranty. I just hope it doesnt go bad again !Update 2: TV went bad with the same issue. Again just before the super bowl - so lasted about 11 months after 1st repair. Samsung said they know the problem and will fix once in the tv life that it has. I called in my extended warranty folks. They came in, change the capacitor in less than 30 minutes and the TV is up and running. so far so good. Expecting next down time in about 6 months time ! Stay away !

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: Kenneth A. Mastro "just some guy"
Reviews.Content: I am still extremely impressed with this television one year into ownership.  The picture quality is simply outstanding, and it looks great hanging on the wall.It has a built-in sub-woofer which helps the sound quite a bit (this is a step up over the 650 model).  We almost always listen with just TV speakers, so it was important to me.  However, at low volumes, the sound is a bit 'tinny', which is par for the course with thin TVs.  Overall, I'd say the sound is top-of-the-line for a flat panel TV, so don't let this deter you.  Listening at normal volume, the sound is better than the large CRT we were using before.Some people complain about a 'halo' around the edge of the screen, and some cosmetic peeling of the 'Touch of Color' (inside the glass of the bezel).  These things exist, but they don't bother me.  The halo is easily solved if it irritates you (just search around, there are a couple ways to do it), and the peeling is so tiny, I can't believe how much people were commenting on it.  You can't even see it unless you're right next to the TV and looking for it.  Maybe we just have a mild case of it.The glossy screen concerned me before I purchased - it almost kept me from pulling the trigger.  I don't regret it in the least.  Now, when I'm looking at TVs for other rooms in the house, I find I WANT a glossy screen because of how attractive it is and how deep the blacks are (note - I don't care for them on laptops because of glare).  However, be wary if there are lots of windows in the room that shine on the TV.  If you're sensitive to this, it could bother you.  (I still think it's worth it, personally.)I also use the TV for gaming (Playstation 3).  I don't bother putting the TV into 'game mode' (which it has), and have zero problems with lag.  Maybe I'm not that sensitive, but I've never noticed any lag at all, actually.  I keep my AMP (Auto Motion Plus?) setting on 'Low'.  Higher settings seem to cause erratic visuals in fast moving scenes, and I suspect will cause some display lag as it does the extra processing.Purchased from Amazon, which was no hassle at all (I was concerned about buying a big ticket item online).  I won't hesitate to buy a TV from them again.  We had zero dead pixels, so no returns were necessary.Finally, note that there is a newer model of this TV (the B750) which is apparently also excellent (I did some quick research).  Although I have no first hand experience with it, it's possible the B750 has a bit more lag than the A750 (if you're looking to use it for any kind of gaming).  Honestly, I sincerely doubt that's an issue and I wouldn't hesitate to buy it.I'm thrilled with my purchase after a year, and would buy again in a heartbeat if the need arose.  We have had zero problems with the TV in that time, which speaks for its reliability.

Reviews.Title: Jordan
Reviews.Author: Daniel J. Lera "djlera"
Reviews.Content: No complaints.  Delivered ahead of schedule. Set up as promised. Phenominal sound and picture.  Very easy to set-up and operate.  I will purchase another Samsung when I buy again.

Reviews.Title: A Wonderful TV!
Reviews.Author: Matthew C. Roper
Reviews.Content: Samsung and Sony are the best in the biz, but Samsung pulls ahead with amazing picture and a very low price point. a must buy for any with a blu-ray player or a PS3/XBOX360!

Reviews.Title: Flawless Picture and Amazing HD Quality
Reviews.Author: Oscar W.
Reviews.Content: I'd just like to start by saying that I wanted to wait at least a month from the time I received this TV so I could give a full and accurate review of my experiences. Unfortunately, I haven't taken advantage of using every feature this TV has to offer, but I think I have experienced enough worthy of a review.First of all - the TV alone, without even being turned on, looks just breathtaking. The look is sleek and fits so well in my living room.Beginning with the set-up, it was a snap.  There's a "plug & play" feature that sets things up for you with the TV stations and channels.  I use an RCA flat antenna that picks up HD local stations.  When the guys delivered the TV and helped set it up (which was very professionally done, I might add) we set up the stations, played with the picture settings a bit and I was off and running.I had no trouble at all hooking everything up to the back of the TV, but I do not have as many peripherals as some people.  I just hooked up my audio cables that go out to my receiver, the antenna to the coaxial and my PS3 to the HDMI.  There are plenty of inputs for whatever you may want to hook up to the TV.Since I've never owned a TV that was 1080p HD, I was practically salivating at the thought of seeing "The Dark Knight" in BluRay on this TV.  All I have to say is WOW!!  This was the first thing I watched within 30 minutes of having the TV, and I sat through the entire movie in awe.  Not just because of the quality of the movie, but the picture quality of the TV.As others have mentioned in their reviews, the colors and whites/blacks are incredible.  I remember reading reviews about how "whites are white and blacks are black..."  I didn't truly understand that until I saw it for myself.  I think the picture quality is just flawless and even though I took some pictures, nothing compares to seeing it in person.One thing I'd like to point out as almost a negative is the 120Hz thing.  Now, whenever I would go into a store to look at this TV, it would be turned on.  I think it works well for sports and maybe some video games.  But there's just something very unnatural about it, in my opinion, when watching regular movies or TV shows.  Others have made similar comments in their reviews, but for me I have not yet had an experience of using that setting that I liked.  It's not really a flaw...  just a feature I don't think is useful except for sports (perhaps?) which I do watch, but not as often as movies or TV.In case you can't tell by any pictures, the tv DOES have controls on the lower right side of the front.  It's all touch-sensitive controls (not sticking out) with power, channel up/down, volume, menu and input. You can't really see it but they're there. kinda neat, in my opinion.ToC - Touch of color... looks nice.  Doesn't bother me at all and I like it.  Very subtle.TV sound - is okay I guess.  I used the TV speakers just once, to test when they set it up, but I use a nice Samsung 5.1 home theater and it's just incredible.  I have no real experience using the TV sound by itself, but others have mentioned displeasure in it.  I can't really comment though.The remote - well, it's okay.  Not the worst but not the best.  I love the buttons... very comfortable and easy to memorize the most commonly used buttons.  but the wheel thing?  That's somewhat worthless.Speaking of worthless...  PIP!  Not worth even using.  Just imagine this TV doesn't have PIP.  You can't swap and the PIP is always a fixed 16:9 ratio, stretching the picture, even if that channel is set to 4:3.  I'm not really a PIP guy though so it's not really something I'm worried about, personally.I wanted to give this TV a 4.5/5 but since amazon doesn't let you do halves, I have to give this TV a full 5/5 stars for everything from the speedy delivery and professionally handled in-home set up to the amazing picture quality this LCD puts out for both blu-ray movies and video games.  Guitar Hero has never been so fun and BluRay movies have never looked so beautiful! :)I hope my review was helpful.------------------------------------------------------------UPDATE:  So I just watched my first NHL hockey game in HD on this TV and am now watching my first HD basketball game.  The 120Hz makes a HUGE difference in the viewing experience and i LOVE it.  It's already Hi-Def so the picture is obviously immaculate.  But with the 120Hz turned on (and I have it on "high") it makes everything seem so smooth and seamless as the action goes from side to side.  I've never seen anything like it.  It almost feels like I'm there.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely Impressed
Reviews.Author: P. Crane
Reviews.Content: 5.0 out of 5 stars Absolutely Impressed, March 6, 2009By  P. Crane - See all my reviews(REAL NAME)The Samsung LN46A750 is an amazing television. I researched televisions for a few weeks before purchasing it. The Amazon reviews made it seem too good to be true so I just wanted to add my review to that category. If you want a sub $1500 46" television than this is THE way to go. Pros and cons follow.Pros: Picture. I have been watching it for a few weeks and even with Time Warner HD the picture is absolutely perfect - clean, clear, colorful. Looking forward to a PS3 with Blue Ray movies to really stretch its HD legs.120 mhz. I read contradictory opinions on this. Should you spend a little more to get a TV with it? Yes. When I first got the TV 120mhz was on and I didn't like the way films appeared.  Titanic (girlfriend wanted to watch it, really) looked "fake" and had a cheesy feel to it.  I turned it off and it looks great.  I do turn it on for sports and Survivor however because it makes you feel like you are on set behind a sheet of glass.DLNA: I am a techie and love this kind of stuff. A networked TV? Great! I have a server running Playon to stream Netflix and Hulu and I actually use the included Samsung Sync to stream AVI files to the TV wirelessly. The Sync software could use a touch of refinement but it works better than others I have tried: TVersity, Vuze, etc. 700MB files look awesome. They are the proper screen size. Lots of potential here untapped.Cons: Huge problem on week 3. The TV no longer powered on :(. Have to admit I was frustrated. It happens I guess and could have been anything from a surge to faulty parts but this is the true test of a company - are they behind you? Samsung support was a great experience. Talked to someone and had a service call in under 15 minutes. Tech was there a few days later, replaced the mainboard (upgraded one no less) and was out. The tech was extremely friendly and professional. Back in action but I'll be getting the extended warranty from Samsung, that was scary. Going back to a standard def analog tube is awful after tasting HD.All the other stuff you can read about in the reviews and specs so I'll cut this short. If you want the best TV in this price range this is the TV to get. I am very happy with this purcahse.

Reviews.Title: TV is great, but Amazon disappoints...
Reviews.Author: I. Hwang "FreddyKhan"
Reviews.Content: ...As others have already alluded to, the PQ is outstanding. I knew that before I received it since I went to BB for side-by-side TV comparisons. People that have no intention of making the purchase from local stores should still go to their local electronic stores to see the difference for themselves.Plenty of praises have been said already, so I'm just going to mention why I chose the 750 over 650. One, I live in a one-bedroom apartment without adequate sound-proofing between apartments. So a dedicated theater SS was out of the question. With the built-in woofer, however, it added depth that I missed from 650 which my brother has. Two, I can play videos from flash drives whereas I can't on 650s (Though I hear later model 650s can?). And soon I'll set up the built-in DLNA which I know I will use a lot. Finally, The difference in price at the time I placed the order was less than $50.00Now, on the Amazon debacle. The TV I have now is a replacement, so, yes, in the end, Amazon delivered. But it took a month of back-and-forth emailing and calling. I had some doubts that the TV I initially received was fresh out of the box. Many of the screws on the back -totalling 9- had visible scuff marks. It had fingerprints all over the screen, and the remote came with its side split. Just signs of tampering everywhere. I relayed this message through email, and the response I got was, "We can't replace the whole TV for scuffed screws that cost just 79 cents each." (Yes, they actually said, '79 cents.') Instead they wanted to send me a new set of screws. Now, why would I ever want to replace the screws on the TV that may mess up the TV and ultimately void a warranty? So I asked for a refund, and I also promised to contact the BBB, and they changed their tune a bit. Or perhaps someone in a better mood than the ".79 dude" decided to answer my email this time. Nevertheless, I did get the replacement TV in the end but not without leaving bad taste in my mouth.

Reviews.Title: Solid Performer
Reviews.Author: M. Wilkens
Reviews.Content: Solid TV overall.  No real complaints at all really.  TV looked amazing out of the box and even better after changing calibration settings found on avsforum.com.The red touch of color might not be a positive selling point for some, but it is much more subtle on the 750 vs. the 650.This TV easily deserves 5 stars, however menu selections lag, often resulting in selecting the wrong option.  Not really a huge problem, I'm just nitpicking at an otherwise beautiful display.Updated woofer adds deeper sound output which can benefit those not using external speaker setups.Halo effect is definitely present around the borders of the bezel, but in my opinion, is noticeable only if: 1. you are looking for it, and 2. if you are viewing it in the dark.  With a light source next to/behind, this effect is not noticeable.I would say I only have two complaints.  1. I wish I would have been able to afford the 52" 750 and 2. It has negatively impacted my workout routine due to increased TV watching.

Reviews.Title: Best TV EVER!!!
Reviews.Author: Victor Avila "jonahgrfx"
Reviews.Content: I have owned this TV for over a month now, and it is simply AMAZING. With the TV on or off- It looks beautiful. All the TOC tv's look great to me. I was originally going to buy the 650, but I really liked the bezel around the 750 better. The built in content is really silly and I don't think I've used once- and that was when I first turned the tv on. I do use the Infolink everyday, though. I didn't think I was going to use it, but it is very cool and useful. If you're looking for a Living room TV, that has a lot of style and quality- look no further. Buy this one!

Reviews.Title: LN46A750 review
Reviews.Author: Kenneth M. Dean II
Reviews.Content: Nice picture and remote.  Lots of HDMI inputs, but the toslink output is only stereo expcept for the dtv tuner which can be dolby digital.  It would be much better if the toslink would pass through dolby digital audio from the hdmi inputs as well.  Only one rf input (cable or antenna).  I would have liked to have 2 rf inputs to feed in both cable and antenna.  I had some issues with loosing the picture when switching between SD and HD channels over the hdmi from a cable dvr.  Solved issues above by adding a Tivo HD receiver which could output a constant 1080i and an av receiver which could switch the hdmi video to decode the audio.

Reviews.Title: Exceeded Expectations
Reviews.Author: Karma Captain "Scott"
Reviews.Content: I'm not a video-phile, I do appreciate quality and I know what I like and I like this product.The reviews that have issues with the bezel color and reflections are for the most part true, however the effect and impact of them on the viewing experience and overall product are minimal.The display is mounted on the wall at about eye level and faces a wall with windows.  My previous Sony rear projection TV had problems displaying with the blinds up which was one of the motivating reasons for changing to an LCD.  I was concerned about the effect of the windows against the glossy surfaces of the LN46A750 but found that the brightness of the display overcomes the brightness of the windows such that while viewing, the windows to not negatively impact the viewing experience.  I guess that its the 50,000:1 contrast ratio spec in play here.I have the display connected to my PC, DVD (gonna go Blue ray soon) and HD Cable through the HDMI inputs.  All viewing is exceptional.  Gotta say that the PC connection is the most astounding.  When viewing a slide show, some of the better quality pictures appear 3 dimensional.Consumer Reports said that image quality @ viewing angle was not the best so I investigated that and came away with a "huh"?  I detect no degradation at any angle that I would care to view the display.Only negative thing is on me, should have bought the 52 incher for my room.  My viewing distances are in the 10-12 foot range.  The 46" is good...the 52" would give me more of a display to watch.

Reviews.Title: You should see this picture
Reviews.Author: J. Barton
Reviews.Content: I bought this back in July and am still amazed at how good this picture looks.  I have gone into the electronic stores and looked at newer models and compared this model.  This model has an equal or superior picture to those newest ones on the floor.  I would have considered aPanasonic or Pioneer if they made an LCD at a larger size.  It would still be difficult to make select another television.  When you are going to by a nice TV - do your homework, seriously, find what you want.  I can tell you though, that this model is a very good choice.

Reviews.Title: samsung ln46a750 review
Reviews.Author: phil freezen
Reviews.Content: Picture is great, sound is great, lots of options.  Like the slide show and photo usb input,  lots of adjustments to fine tune the picture and sound the way you like.  Don't know what the big deal is about the RED touch of color.  Haven't quite figured out what that is, either mine is not working or it doesn't make any difference.  Oh well great set for the price.

Reviews.Title: GREAT TV!
Reviews.Author: Youtzy "Dan"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV about a month ago, and have been very pleased with it. I researched TV's for about 3-4 weeks looking at all specs, etc. The things I loved most about this TV were its build quality, the future proofing (120Hz refresh rate) and the cost vs size. The picture quality of this TV is GREAT (of course a big difference is ALWAYS the source of the program you are watching).A couple things I would recommend...If you buy this TV online during the winter time in an area that gets cold, MAKE SURE you let it sit for at least 3-5 hours before you turn it on. Many places online state 24 hours (which I think is a little excessive). This allows for any moisture from the cool air to dry off of the pannel inside the TV if any is present.The second thing I recommend is upgrading the firmware to the latest and greatest from Samsung's website. The firmware on mine was factory default from the initial release of the TV.Other than that, I have LOVED the TV. One thing I will advise is that you get a blu-ray player. Once you watch hi-def, you will NEVER want to go back on this TV!

Reviews.Title: Samsung A750
Reviews.Author: C. Arlotta
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful television, both looks and picture quality.  I had friends over for the holidays, and they couldn't believe the clarity of the picture.  When adding the HD service, it's unbelievable.  I would recommend this to everyone.  No problems that I've noticed.

Reviews.Title: samsung LN46A750 1080p DLNA LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: Justin Nguyen
Reviews.Content: I'm very happy with this Samsung LN46A750, last month I've purchased 2 Samsung LN32A650 LCD HDTV for my 2 daughters, picture quality is perfect and I've got this LN46A750 for my living room after that. Honestly this was beyond my expectation, specially the sound, the speakers were built right on the back of this TV, beautiful sound with this TV without the need of external power amps or preamps, at the volume of 50 it will rock your living room. Highly recommended to all buyers. Thanks Amazon for fast delivery and great services.

Reviews.Title: Experience the 120Hz Frame Rate
Reviews.Author: T. Kohari
Reviews.Content: The 120Hz frame rate might take a while to get used to. It makes you feel a little bit weird at first. The default setting is set to Medium for the 120 frame rate, but if you change it to Low it makes it feel a lot better.The color is also very amazing. I played a bluray disc on it and it looks just awsome. The color is so bright that I actually feel like I am in the movie. It actually might look TOO real.The contrast ratio was also very good. There is not that many TVs that can beat this contrast ratio with this price. It black make the color look even better.The only one thing that I did not really like about this TV is that the surface reflects light a lot. You will be able to see yourself watching TV sometimes. But as long as the room is not too bright, there is no problem at all.

Reviews.Title: Impressive
Reviews.Author: T. Gower
Reviews.Content: I have owned this TV for a couple of weeks now and I am really impressed by the quality of the picture.  When researching this TV I saw that many people were concerned about the red edge and also about the halo effect around the edge of the picture.  Neither of those have been an issue.  I view this at an angle and have yet to see the halo.  I guess you really have to be looking for it.  I would definitely recommend this to anyone looking for an HDTV.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: LCD TV Watcher "LCD TV Watcher"
Reviews.Content: I bought the 750 direct from Amazon and got it about 2 weeks ago.  The picture is simply wonderful.  I did a lot of research on this and it definitely is worth the money.  There *is* a halo problem dealing with the bezel but it has been corrected in newer sets and older sets can have it replaced by Samsung.  Personally, the small halo on my set is not a problem.  I would like to comment on the Amazon "White Glove Delivery".  It was CEVA and Eagle who delivered the set.  Two guys delivered it and they were pretty amenable to helping me set it up.  I had a 277lb Sony tube behemoth, which they took off the stand for me.  I couldn't bribe them to take it outside or take it away.  They then waited long enough for me to make sure the TV worked with my cable box.  So the delivery was fine.  To close...let me say again how much we love the picture on this set.  We only have a regular DVD player right now but even that looks great.  Next purchase....blu-ray!

Reviews.Title: Samsung  46" HDTV mdl 750
Reviews.Author: Wayne M. Peavey
Reviews.Content: This TV has a gorgeous picture & good sound. All features work well, & the owner manual is easy to understand. Setup is easy. I was watching my favorite team pummel its opponent 5 min after the courteous & well-trained deliverymen removed it from the box. I would definitely recommend it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: Best TV Now (2008)
Reviews.Author: Alexis Naranjo "Alexis"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV directly form Amazon, I spent a couple of months reading reviews like this and also going to showrooms and I got to tell you this TV performs better than most plasmas (Not Pioneer one), I compare contrast deep of black and colors, and they are far better compared with most other models.My only dissapointment is the remote, I don't like the design and I find it very large and uncomfortable, still very usable but ugly.About the plastic border is not really a complain, at least it doesn't reflect it's own tv light as others reviews said. It will be nice if you can add a soft back light to enhance contrast and make your TV look better.The sound is better than average TV's and the image quality is impressive, upscaling low definition channels with almost no artifacts and showing perfectly HD channels. Í'm really impressed.I'm using regular cable with no HD decoder and will upgrade soon, but quality is awesome.Delivery took almost 1 week and a half but was as expected, perfectly delivered with no damages.Thanks Amazon, same TV @ *estBuy was 2399 + tax + S&H.; I paid $1699.

Reviews.Title: surpassed expectations
Reviews.Author: Gregory M. Hirsch
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on 46" plasma televisions, I visited local Best Buy and Circuit City stores. Having an interest in Samsung, I priced the Samsung LN46A750 and then checked Amazon. The price savings after factoring in sales tax differential etc. was greater than $400. After my Amazon order, the television was delivered to my house in 8 days..no hassles clean as a whistle. As for the TV, it compares favorably to the very nice 50" Pioneer I bought 3 years ago. The combination of price and incredible picture on this Samsung is hard to beat!

Reviews.Title: My wife didnt notice "halo" effect
Reviews.Author: Dmitry G
Reviews.Content: I dont wanna talk about how great this TV is. There are 100 reviews about how great this TV is and I 100% agree.I just wanna add few throughts about "halo" effect. I believe reason why Samsung came up with idea of sharp see-through clear edges cut at 45 degrees is to create feeling that this TV is absolutely flat. If you stand in front of it you get this feeling that its a flat screen and there is nothing behind it. Thats a great selling point. Design is everything when people choose from good quality tvs with similar price.Unfortunately this clear edge creates "halo" effect which is very noticeable in the dark. When I saw this TV first time I didnt notice it but it was during daytime. Then I read about halo effect online before I bought the TV. Sure enough I notice it but its not too bad. My most surprise is that after a few months my wife still havent noticed it. That tells me if I didnt read the reviews I would've been thinking that everything was just super.....

Reviews.Title: What a tv !!
Reviews.Author: Howard D. Jackson
Reviews.Content: I thought long and hard about replacing a perfectly good 27"Toshiba with this unit.  LCD vs CRT, no longer an issue with me, CRT's are history.  Samsung/Amazon delivered a great product on time with the advertised white glove delivery, it actually works inspite of what others may say.  The delivery folks set the unit up, had me screw in the cable connector,and walked us through the TV menue.  What a great experience, delivered as advertised, a bit earlyier than expected but the tracking system was right on and early rather than late notification worked fine.

Reviews.Title: BEST TV- BEST PRICE- BEST DELIEVERY!
Reviews.Author: L. A. Anderson
Reviews.Content: Am one to review and research something very carefully before buying something, 3 trips to the store to see it in person and hours of research on line.This is our second HDTV, so I do have some expreiance. The one thing that trouble me the most where the worst reviews. The edge bleed of picture along the sides of the outer glass, it does happen. If this is a destraction for you, then you must of lost your marbles. The HD picture is so beautiful your not looking at anything else, so maybe my recommendation try watching the TV for what it was indenied for.Provided with the the package is soft cleaning cloth, I read in someone review tiny scatches will appear. USE THE CLOTH THAT COMES WITH THE TV! :)We had the TV professionally installed, and had one problem with mounting the mounting bracket(tilt). In order to get the full tilt, I had to run up to the hardware store and purchased a recesed plug(the old kitchen clock style AC plug) this placed the AC power plug inside the wall and out of the way.May wife said the deleivery was unlike anything she has seen, perfect, the white glove indeed. Great Job for them and great job to Amazon! Thank You!

Reviews.Title: very pleased exceptional lcd tv
Reviews.Author: Edgar A. Smith "E A Smith"
Reviews.Content: This is the best picture on any lcd tv, and most plazma tv's I viewed. I spent several weeks looking for what I felt had the best picture, reputation, and overall "look".  I heard bad reports on Amazon shipping on large tv's, and they were not true in my case, the item came in good condition, and 5 days early, with excellent service by the driver and his helper.  The shipper was CEVA.

Reviews.Title: Samsung DLNA LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: Indian Rider
Reviews.Content: Money well spent, the definition is outstanding throughout all the channels but especially the HD ones. I am watching the olympics right now and it is as though I have seats at the cube in Beijing.

Reviews.Title: Love This TV
Reviews.Author: Robert S. Davies
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic picture.This is my 3 {third} Samsung 46" These TV's blow away other sets[Sony}and others....

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN 46A 750 46 inch LCD TV
Reviews.Author: Mike L
Reviews.Content: This is without a doubt the best purchase I ever made. This tv is outstanding in everyway. Just a great TV. And I saved $800.00 from buying it from a local store in my hometown I would buy another one without hesitationMike L Peoria, IL.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 46A750 46" LCD TV
Reviews.Author: Robert F. Moreno "Bob"
Reviews.Content: I searched, researched, read all your reviews here and finally bought the Samsung 46A750. We have had this TV for about 3 weeks now. First off the shipping was fine no problems. The TV operated great right out of the box. The technical merits of this TV are awesome it met all my expectations. If you want to know the specifications read Samsung's, the TV matches and sometimes surpasses the spec's. The picture is fantastic. We use Direct TV with HD and all channels are awesome. Regular SD pictures take on a much much finer detail. The HD pictures are even more Awesome. The sound is also very very good. This LCD TV has so many inputs and outputs that it makes all connections very easy to make. We are so very happy with this TV. I cannot say enough about this Samsung LCD, it is the best TV we have ever purchased. Oh and Amazon's price was the turning point, $600 less than anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: Unreal
Reviews.Author: R. Nelson
Reviews.Content: After months of research, I was sold on this TV, but the price at the outlet stores held me back from pulling the trigger.  So this review really is not on the TV, because this is currently the best LCD on the market hands down!  look in that for yourself!  This review is really on purchasing a major item through AMAZON.When a friend told me to check out the price at AMAZON! I did and UNREAL!  Amazon was $400 below Best Buy and Circuit Cityand because I live in Michigan - no sales tax - UNREAL.  I was very sceptical to buy on-line, so I again did much research on AMAZON and their white glove deliver.  Well even though I was a little nervous, I ordered the TV.  The price was great and I have since called due to a lower price and they gladly credited my card back the difference (they price match for 30 days - but it must be in stock through AMAZON).The TV arrived and everything was above my exceptations.  You can track your order very easily through AMAZON'S website.  My TV arrived without an issue within about 1 week.  The delivery service called to setup a delivery time.  Showed up on time in a very professional manner.  Took the TV out of the box and placed it on the stand.  Then made sure it powered up!  They will take away your box but I recommend to keep it in case of a return.  Overall, this experience was great - I have a great TV and I saved about $400 buck a roni's!  If your going to mount your TV to a wall make sure your order your bracket through amazon as well - about $150 less than Best Buy!As the Monkey's sang - I'm a Believer - yeah yeah yeah yeah!

Reviews.Title: First 12 hours review
Reviews.Author: Mr T
Reviews.Content: Had this TV for about 12 hours, initial impressions:Pros:  - Awesome picture - images seem to pop out from it. Much nicer than my other Samsung LCD (40").  - Sound is pretty good. Obviously not as good as when hooked to stereo, but acceptable for most things.Cons:  - remote is rather long - I'd opt for smaller buttons instead of the 10" (or whatever) length. Also, the scroll wheel is kind of awkward - try to press right or left with it, it tends to scroll first.  - No swivel base (don't know if the product description says it has one or not - just assumed it would, since my older Samsung has one)  - Timer - can only select Cable or Air input for timer operation (on at 6AM, etc), not HDMI or anything else. Whats up with that?Haven't noticed the 'halo' effect yet - now that I've read about it...Overall, very happy.

Reviews.Title: good while it works, terrible customer service
Reviews.Author: roc_doc
Reviews.Content: The picture and functionality were very good in the 45 days it worked. The only quibble would be with the sound - the rear firing speakers are almost useless, so an external sound system is a must.The most important issue is that it abruptly died after a month and a half, as mentioned. At the time of this review I am one month later, the TV is under warranty, and it is still sitting in my basement dead. Samsung customer care is a disaster. After setting me up with the wrong local service, wasting a lot of time, they connected me with a local repair shop that ordered parts without checking to see what was wrong first! Of course they were the wrong parts. The request to Samsung to comply with the rule they had given me that they allow 3 weeks for repairs and then replace the item fell on deaf ears. There is no commitment from them on a time frame to do anything about it, so we are at the whims of the Gods... Also disturbing, the technician who came to my home (with the wrong parts...) told me these models were known to have huge problems, with the display and others, which is one of the reasons for the rapid succession of the next series of LCD's from Samsung.I am never buying a Samsung product again.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture Quality
Reviews.Author: tbish "tbish"
Reviews.Content: Samsung A750 46" LCD has a great picture.  Much better than any other brand that I saw in stores prior to purchasing it.  Touch of Red just adds to the beauty.  Great buy and grat value. Would highly recomend.  Just have one question: When you first turn TV on---the screen reads across the top  1980x1080i @ 60hz.  Why does it say 60 hz when I have the 120 hz on and set to the high position?

Reviews.Title: Great for TV and Moive Picture quality, not for games
Reviews.Author: Tyler Brooks
Reviews.Content: So, I bought this tv becuase Samsung seems to be the best brand at the moment. I have had it for about a week and the picture really is astounding. I have been watching alot of over-the-air digital channels, (with my bunny ears) and i am constantly amazed. The same goes for movies. However i hooked up my video game console to this tv and when I tried to play, all of the movements on screen were about .1-.2 seconds behind me pushing the button on the controller. It is not huge but in any action oriented game it makes a differnece. I have loved everything else the menus are easy for me to scroll through, once i became accustomed to the scroll wheel on the remote, and the speakers are good as far as TV speakers go. It is really too bad about the lag for gaming though

Reviews.Title: Great TV!!!!
Reviews.Author: Vicki S. Hall "Happy in Illinois"
Reviews.Content: This TV was well worth the money.  Picture quality is unbelievable.  We were undecided between a 40" and 46" because we have a small living room.  But now we know we made the right decision.  We have our PC, Wii and DVD player hooked up and it is just a click of a button to switch between components.  We will be purchasing HDMI cables and a Blue Ray to make this experience even better.  On board sound on this model is great.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 46-inch LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: Gary McDermott
Reviews.Content: The delivery guys brought the set into the house, set it on our stand, and turned it on to verify that it worked.  The TV's performance and picture is excellent.  Great delivery service and great product!

Reviews.Title: Great LCD
Reviews.Author: Amazon Creature
Reviews.Content: Super product. Easy set-up. Could use some buttons in case I lose the remote, but otherwise a flawless product.Worried a little about the red border and the refelective rim, but I've never noticed them when actually watching something.

Reviews.Title: Incredible picture
Reviews.Author: Slaktarn
Reviews.Content: Bought the Samsung LN46A750 for the Olympics as a replacement for an old HD-Ready Toshiba 36. Extremely pleased with the picture quality.

Reviews.Title: I Love TV Now
Reviews.Author: William G. Leaming
Reviews.Content: Not being much for a lot of TV I can certainly see myself becoming a TV junky now.The picture and options are fantastic.  WII games are also awesome

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT! Thanks AMAZON & Ceva!
Reviews.Author: La Sleepy
Reviews.Content: We researched a bit and shopped around like most people do when they are about to shell out a chunk of benji's! :-)  Reviews of the 650 were very helpful, and surprisingly the price difference between the two models was only a few dollars!!!! :-)  We ordered on a Monday and surprisingly CEVA delivered on a Friday, 3 days earlier than expected! CEVA white glove delivery was professional and we were impressed at how quick the set up was.  He didn't wait for the entire channel scanning to complete, but everything worked and we kept the box just in case.The lcd sits on a media table using the non-swivel/tilt stand. The lcd looks so awesome - a perfect addition and upgrade from my Sony 27in flat screen tube. The TOC is very subtle - and often times I don't notice it.  We have yet to purchase a blu ray, but the dvd upconverter makes the picture quality of old DVDs AMAZING!! The HD channels I have access to right now are also very stunning! We're really enjoying this new set and watching the olympics with such clarity - love 120HZ!  Have not really adjusted the settings, but I agree with others that the "click wheel" remote takes some time to get used to.We did notice the "halo effect" on the bezel when we watch in the dark - but this is only slightly noticeable at certain angles.  The picture quality is so brilliant that we are not at all distracted by it.We'll be looking into blu ray that also has a dvd-r.  Any recommendations?  Is this device out yet?Oh, any chance that swivel/tilt stands from older model samsung can work with this one?  I like how the 650 swivels. :-)

Reviews.Title: Samsung Series 7 - Highly recommended
Reviews.Author: L McGruder "Glued to the TV"
Reviews.Content: The Samsung Series 7, 46" HD LCD was easy to connect; I had the TV and home theater system connected in about 10 minutes.  Initial TV setup was easy and intuitive.  The menu items and submenu items are intuitive.  The HD picture quality is absolutely awesome.  I have not seen any of the flaws attributed to previous generations of LCD TVs, e.g., blurred response to action scenes.  The remote selections are intuitive.  In particular, it has a tools menu that contains most of the selections that you would use  on a regular basis. The user's manual is very comprehensive, explaining the details of different operating modes. PS: Amazon's "White Glove" delivery service was also great.

Reviews.Title: Incredible picture, but not built to last.
Reviews.Author: Joshua D. Washburn "jwashbur"
Reviews.Content: I'm sad to say that I've told so many people how amazing Samsung TVs are. I was a proud owner of this model for 4.5 years. As I write this review, my TV is at a local repair shop. Thankfully I purchased a 5 year warranty for $300+. Samsung came out and replaced a board after 3 years to fix the problem where the TV shut off and turned on by itself.The most recent issue is 4 horizontal lines going across the screen every time we turn on the TV. They go away after 15-20 minutes. The repair shop said that it's an indication of a bad LCD panel. That means the warranty company will either buy me a new TV of comparable specifications or send me a check for the full retail value.Bummer! I truly enjoyed having this awesome TV. Samsung, I hope, is making a better product now.

Reviews.Title: My model was just so, so
Reviews.Author: Don J. G.
Reviews.Content: Right after the warrantly ran out I start to get verticle lines when ever there was a crawl at the bottome of the page. I have lived with it but am disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Samsung tv a lemon
Reviews.Author: Swan Three
Reviews.Content: We purchased this set in 2009 and it now suffers from the problem that is well documented here:  [...]Samsung won't do anything about it as it is outside the warranty.  At the same time, 4 years seems like a short lifespan for a set this expensive.  At this point, I'm not very inclined to purchase a Samsung replacement.

Reviews.Title: problems galore
Reviews.Author: KW
Reviews.Content: In the 5 years that we have had this tv, it has had 2 major problems.  It first had a power-on issue due to faulty capacitors just a few months after the warranty was up.  I am an electrical engineer and was able to replace these myself.  Samsung has in the last year been reimbursing owners for this repair.  The second issue arose in the last year when you powered on the TV cold.  The screen has 3 white horizontal lines that divide the screen and a 'ghosting' of the image on the left side.  This remains until the TV has heated up and then it resolves itself.  The problem has continued to worsen over the last year.  First only when the house temp was low and then it would clear after a few minutes use.  Now it is at every use and takes 15-20 minutes to resolve.  Google search has shown that this is another prevalent Samsung issue.  There are do-it-yourself instructions on how to fix resolve this issue yourself by applying pressure to the panel ribbon cables, but Samsung has not stepped up to repair.  I won't be buying another Samsung TV.

Reviews.Title: Last Samsung I will ever buy...
Reviews.Author: AlphaPapa
Reviews.Content: This TV was great for about 2 years.  Then it started turning off for no reason and started taking a long time to turn on.  Had it repaired under warranty (extended warranty purchased from BB). A year later just under the 3 year mark the same thing started happening.  Again it was repaired under warranty.  Three months later just outside of warranty it started having blurring and ghosting issues on the left half of the screen.  I called Samsung and they were unwilling to work with me at all.  They have lost a customer for life.  This TV has been a nightmare and I would have expected a $1,400 TV to last more than 3 years.  This is the last Samsung I ever buy, they make a poor quality product and do not stand behind it.

Reviews.Title: Samsung is great
Reviews.Author: A. Davis
Reviews.Content: We have had this tv now for quite some time and so far it has performed splendidly.  A beautiful picture.  The sound is not the greatest but that is probably due to the size of the speakers that are necessary to fit into the narrow width of the screen.  The size of the font for the closed captions is quite small.  I contacted Samsung concerning this via email to determine if the font size can be increased but never received an answer from Samsung.

Reviews.Title: excellent tv
Reviews.Author: Nicholas Starinsky
Reviews.Content: Bought it for in-laws. It runs 4 hours a day since 2008 w/o any issues or service calls.Excellent video quality. I think larger bezel allowed Samsung to cool this tv better, thus,extending its life.

Reviews.Title: Still impressive after 3 years
Reviews.Author: M & A
Reviews.Content: I got this TV as a graduation present back in summer of 2008. Today, it still works as good as the day I first got it. I have used it almost every single day usually for an average of three hours. I haven't noticed any degradation in quality and performance at all (I hope I didn't just jinx myself). I do make sure I wipe off dust from time to time as I just really like the clean glossy black finish. There is a halo effect due to the clear glass frame at the edges, but that doesn't bother me much. This should really only be an annoyance when you want it to be absolutely pitched black in the room when watching a movie. Otherwise, I like the look of the border during the day.I have used it with my PS3, as a second monitor for my PC, and survived a move to my new home. There are plenty of cable connections in the back, but I have only used the HDMI ports. I used the on/off timer feature as my backup alarm clock. I like the flexibility it allows such specifying recurrence via day of the week. I also like the backlit remote control. Makes it so much easier to use the remote in a dark room.So far, this TV has stood the test of time and is performing as good as it did on day 1. I don't see myself craving for the new LED 3D 480Hz or whatever new iteration of TV technology is out there. The 46" size is also very sufficient in my 20"x16" living room. I watch the TV from the kitchen breakfast counter about 20' away and the picture is clear. Hope it stays the way it is for many many years to come.

Reviews.Title: Great T.V. but too complicated beyond basic functions
Reviews.Author: Prad Bitt
Reviews.Content: I've had the T.V, for some time now and it still works very well.....no complaints, though the sound is pretty average...but, seriously, don't you want to get surround sound anyway?

Reviews.Title: Delaminating frame - kudos to Samsung
Reviews.Author: KeyJey
Reviews.Content: We have had this television since 2008 and generally love it.  We use it with surround sound so the meager sound doesn't matter so much to us.  We just realized the touch of color was delaminating in the frame.  A quick google search revealed that this is a frequent problem with this television.We called Samsung and pressed through the level one customer service rep who wanted to do exactly nothing.  We pressed for a second tier person -- an executive customer service rep.  With some mild pressing, she agreed to extend the warranty on the television and Samsung had the television repaired at their expense.  The repair was made in our home today.  The repairman told us that some LGs delaminated at the screen and I read online that it has happened to Sonys.As an aside, this tv is known for having a glow off the outer edge of the frame.  The replacement frame has no glow!If you have a delamination problem, call Samsung.  Good on them!

Reviews.Title: Top of the line
Reviews.Author: GBK25
Reviews.Content: I strongly believe that Samsung has the best line of HD TVs available.  I have not yet seen a TV able to match the picture I get for the price I paid.  I have had this TV for over a year and still get amazed from time to time when watching HD TV shows/movies.  Very nice design and easy to use remote.

Reviews.Title: the wireless linkstick is out of market - no any support from samsung
Reviews.Author: C. Chiang
Reviews.Content: Samsung posted comment on the CNET that the LN##A### is 08 model, since it is 08 model, so the linkstick (WIS-08BGxx) is not produced any more.  So if you want to have wireless network with your PC, this is not for youto buy.  The question is why they still make this 08 model on the market with fake description to cheat on the customer.  My guess is Samsung plans to have this function BUT FAILED and they do not want to solve this problem at all (may be they do NOT have this ability to fix it)!

Reviews.Title: I love this.  I wish I purchased a 65 inch unit.
Reviews.Author: GManBMe "G-Man"
Reviews.Content: Don't forget, when you purchase a rectangular tv most broadcasts are square. Go figure. You need to purchase a larger unit than you think.  I purchased a 46 inch tv but most broadcasts come out in HD which is 38 inches. Why make all of us purchase HD rectangular tv's when HD is broadcast in a square format?  Next well all have to purchase round tv's to view a rectangular format.  Only in America!  And I love America!  Generations of USA born AmericansProud to be an American but we go along with some pretty strange ideas!

Reviews.Title: Remote doesn't work
Reviews.Author: kmuse "kmuse"
Reviews.Content: Remote only worked for one day; a warrantied replacement will take up to 2 weeks.  I ordered a replacement from parts dept - extra cost for quick delivery: $78.  TV is quite useless without a remote.

Reviews.Title: Amazing HDTV!
Reviews.Author: Loud is Dallas "LoudisDallas"
Reviews.Content: I am 100% satisfied and more than pleased with my purchase!  I have had my 46" LCD for seven months and am still blown away by the pristine and sharp picture.Like most, I was a little torn between brand (Sony or Samsung) and size (40", 46" or 52").Samsung was THE best price for quality and size after months of searching.  Sony looked good, but I felt like the design of the Samsung was sleeker and more pleasing to the eye and I got a 46" 1080p w/ 120Hz for a MUCH better price than a comparable Sony.I looked at the LED LCD for an instant, but for the price right now, it just isn't worth it in my opinion if you are price conscious.The added features, like weather and news are pretty cool, and the included images are nice to put on during a party or if you are just relaxing around.  If wall mounted, you can have breathtaking photos or paintings all the time.I, like several others, was concerned with the possible "halo" that might be present while viewing.  I have not even thought about or noticed it in my seven months of owning this HDTV.  HDTV looks great in low and no light.I am so very pleased with my purchase and buying through Amazon was a breeze!  I don't think I will ever buy from a big box store again (especially Best Buy, I received little to NO customer service from them).So should you purchase this item?  Absolutely.Samsung 46" 1080p w/ 120Hz YES!Amazon.com  YES!

Reviews.Title: Great LCD TV!
Reviews.Author: Master Geek
Reviews.Content: I have been using this TV for last one year now and it has been great. I am so happy with the performance. The quality of picture is amazing. Even for the normal channels it enhances the display.I had read before buying that some customers were not happy about the glare in sun-lit room but ours is well-lit room and we do not face any problem. Reviews.Content: 1) I decided in Nov 2008 to buy a new tv after my brother snagged a ln40a550.  He had no problems with his LCD so I gravitated towards an a550, a630, a650 and eventually a750 due to the price and bang for buck quotient.What you like best about your LCD.- Connections galore, I have Comcast HD/DVR from Motorola, Sony DAV-HDX275 HTIB, and PS2 hooked up. Wish i could play Netflix straight to TV.What you don't like about your LCD.Calibration options are so reliant on firmware/panel manufacture, so many of the settings that i've found don't look good for me.  However, I used mostly Standard and Movie picture settings with some adjustments and am happy with picture.What was your biggest "Surprise" after you received your LCD.-SD channels are hit or miss. Reviews.Title: No Wireless!
Reviews.Author: Jake "Research Everything"
Reviews.Content: First of all I will say that after much research I bought this television.  The picture is stunning!  Standard broadcast looks pretty decent and the HD broadcasts are amazing.  It is so clear that you can see every detail on actors faces and you realize that they cannot airbrush actors when you are dealing with high definition television.  I like the reality this tv presents.The comments about the difficult to use remote were unfounded and it seems quite straight forward to me.  I also have not had any problem with light bleeding into the room or any ambient light issues.  So I am glad that I didn't listen to the negative reviews here.  It could be that the issue was resolved by the time my set was manufactured in January 2009.My only disappointment was with the fact that my ten day old new television purchase does not have any option for wireless Internet.  The wireless link stick that is supposed to provide this functionality has been discontinued.  I contacted Samsung customer care and they were truly worthless as was their online submission form.  Both the online and phone support told me to contact their part supplier.  The part supplier and the phone support told me that it had been discontinued.  There was no further information available.  I know they had extensive problems with the link stick device, but it makes you wonder what kind of company pulls a product feature on a current production television.So if you have to pay a premium for this set and expected wireless capabilities you will be disappointed.  I expect that I will eventually hook this up to a media center pc and therefore can work around this issue.  Luckily for me I paid about the same amount as the 650 series and I don't have any regrets.
