Reviews.Title: A non-techie's love affair with her TV
Reviews.Author: Bookphile
Reviews.Content: For quite some time, my husband and I made due with a small, rather old TV.  When it finally came time to buy ourselves an HD, he did a lot of the research, being more technologically inclined than I am.  After reading rafts of reviews, he suggested that we purchase this model.First and foremost, the picture quality is phenomenal.  There are issues with glare, so we do have to keep the blinds directly across from the TV closed for the most part but that's a very minor annoyance in comparison with the richness of the colors and the depth of the picture we now enjoy.  Sports in particular are breathtaking on the screen and sitting and watching in your living room truly does feel almost like being there when watching an event through this model.  We haven't progressed to the Blu-Ray phase yet but the picture quality of our DVDs is also quite nice.One of my favorite features of the TV is the USB port.  It's so easy to plug a USB stick into the side of the TV and view pictures, watch videos, play music, etc.  I didn't fully realize the potential of this feature until we got the TV and began to use it in earnest.  We now frequently make use of it.The USB port is also handy for the home A/V kit that came with my recently purchased Microsoft Zune.  Thanks to the subwoofer that's built into the TV, the sound quality is quite good.  I can easily connect the A/V kit to the TV and use it to play music on my Zune while I'm doing things like cooking and cleaning and I also frequently use it to play music for my daughter while she's playing.  Again, this is another feature that I wouldn't really have thought about but now that I have it, I find it pretty indispensable.The overall look of the TV is very sleek and the slight hint of red along the edges helps give it an elegant look.  I never found TVs particular attractive in the past but I'm happy now to have something that looks good in my living room, even when it's turned off.  I also truly and passionately love having a flat screen rather than our old, cumbersome TV.  It's much easier to handle, much easier to keep clean, and now I don't have to worry about my husband getting a hernia when he has to move the TV.All in all, I'm extremely happy with this purchase--which is good, considering it was a major buy.  We haven't had any problems with the TV whatsoever and it was very nice to be able to bypass one of the big box electronic stores and have the TV shipped directly to our home rather than having to figure out how we would transport it here.

Reviews.Author: J. Bradsher
Reviews.Content: 3/10/09- We have had the television for about a month now.  So far I have absolutely nothing negative to write about it. Reviews.Title: LN46A750 - Everything that I expected!
Reviews.Author: E. Mason
Reviews.Content: I ordered this tv last year after MONTHS of research on LCD televisions and comparisons between brands.  I went with this model because of the "future features" like the DLNA and network jack, but also because of the specs of this particular panel.  A lot of people will tell you to just go with the 650 over the 750 because they are virtually the same, but they are not!  The 750 actually has a better panel than the 650, according to some sites, and a better processor for that panel.  If you need to find specs, go to the AVS forums and look them up by model.The TV looked good right out of the box, but after some tweaking, it really looks fantastic!  I used some calibration settings from AVS forums and WOW!  Colors look rich and natural, not over-saturated and bright.  Black levels on this tv are excellent (the 52 inch model is rated excellent by Consumer Reports) and the sound really isn't bad for TV speakers.  The woofers built in make a difference in depth when you are listening.Now, I have noticed the "halo effect" when all the lights are off and we are watching a movie with lots of bright backgrounds and such, but other than that, I never notice it.  It isn't significant enough for me to make it a deal breaker.  Some people also complain about the screen being too reflective.  The screen actually is somewhere between a matte screen and a glossy.  You will notice reflections if you have light behind you or a window behind you, but in my home, the only light we have is an overhead...all lamps are to the side, and are not visible when watching.  So, the reflection doesn't bother me at all...it is quite minimal in my opinion.  In fact, the screen actually provides extra black and color depth that I don't see on other people's HDTVs. (Sony, Sharp, etc...and those are good brands, as well.)All in all, I am very happy with my purchase, and my family LOVES the tv.

Reviews.Title: Stunning!
Reviews.Author: G. Neltnor "G-no$"
Reviews.Content: I spent a LONG time researching (and more importantly, saving) for my upgrade to an HDTV as I'm sure most do.  I was initially looking at the Samsung HDTVs, and changed my mind a few times between several different models.After reading reviews I had my decision down to two models, this one and the Panasonic Viera with the THX certification.  I read the differences between the 650 and 750 samsung and I really liked the look of the 750 better plus the features of the "better" audio with included woofer so when the 750 prices dropped lower than the 650, I jumped on it, and I have not been disappointed for one second.This tv is incredible.  The "halo" effect that you hear about is there slightly, but it is not a problem at all, I barely notice it and probably would notice it a lot less if I hadn't read about it so much in the forums.The upgraded audio of the tv is really nothing special. The simulated surround sound does work well, but I had a projection tv prior that had great audio so that maybe why I don't have high grades for the audio on this tv, its good but does not stand out in my opinion.Overall, this television is just stunning.  I've had it about a month now and I still have a grin when watching it, its just amazing, the picture quality is second to none at the moment.  The AMP settings are great and I really couldn't ask for anything more with a TV.  My only regret is not buying the 52" model, but for the extra money I'd rather pick up a PS3!I recommend going to AVS Forums and getting the audio and video calibration settings or having a pro calibrate the picture, it is well worth it!

Reviews.Title: 4.5 out of 5 - I rounded up
Reviews.Author: William Perez "wilnva"
Reviews.Content: I would give this LCD TV a 4.5 point score if I could.  However, I rounded up to 5 because the flaws are minor ones in my opinion and do not warrant a full point deduction.This is our first HDTV and the picture is amazing.  The colors are crisp and the blacks look superb.  I was concerned about glare at first because we have a lot of ambient light (from windows, doorways and a half wall) in our living room, but it has not been a problem.  The connections are plentiful even though I could use a couple more legacy connections while I'm building up funds to upgrade my other equipment.  My old progressive scan DVD player only outputs 480p and this TV upscales the picture beautifully.  The Xbox 360 looks great on it and hopefully I'll get to see some Blu-ray content on it in the future.  It works really well as a second monitor for the Laptop - digital pictures look great at 46 inches.  Over the air DTV looks great too.  The sound quality is pretty good.  We only turn on the surround sound receiver for movies because the speakers are more than adequate for average daily use.  The TOC feature is very subtle and doesn't detract from the viewing pleasure.  I have yet to experience the "halo effect" on my set that many have commented on.  It has taken a bit for me to get used to the short warm-up time for LCDs.  Coming from a CRT with practically no warm-up time it seems longer than it really is.  The Auto Motion Plus (AMP) feature is hit or miss.  I'm not sure if I'll get used to it or not.  With DVDs and the AMP on high, the picture looks over-processed to me.  My wife's description was the most accurate, "it reminds me of a BBC documentary."I was originally looking at the 650, but when I was about ready to purchase Amazon had the 750 listed for 80 dollars less than the 650.  It seemed like a no-brainer to me when combined with the other offers/rebates at the time (late Jan 2009).  The delivery was quicker than stated and it was nice having someone unbox it and put it on the TV stand for me.  I also was able to go down the delivery check list before signing off on it (does it work, is there physical damage, do you get a picture on screen, etc).  No matter what anyone says, the white glove delivery is worth it (maybe not at full price, but definitely when free) because you can easily see defects and refuse delivery on the item.  Regular delivery only really allows for visible box damage, not defective products.  I am more than satisfied with my purchasing experience.My real complaints are minor because they don't affect my every day use.  First of all, the internal storage is a great concept, but I misunderstood its purpose when reading the specs.  I thought I would be able to access and utilize this space, but that is not the case.  The internal storage only stores content from Samsung and so far I've been unable to figure out how to add content to it (even Samsung's additional content for download).  Additional content must be loaded on a flash drive and accessed via the Wiselink port.  It just seems kind of gimmicky and I think it could have been implemented so much better.  Imagine having a 46" digital picture frame for parties, etc.  My second complaint is the PIP feature.  It is not a fully developed feature, as others have bemoaned.  However, one annoyance for me in particular is that I can't even use it to view two broadcast channels using a digital converter box through the AV input.  The only inputs that allow PIP are component, HDMI and PC.  The limited functionality and difficulty involved in finding the PIP options in the menu baffle me.  I had PIP on my previous CRT television and rarely used it, but it was fully developed and easy to use.  I would be more inclined to use it on this set with the side-by-side feature if it were easier to use and fully functional.  For this kind of money I would have expected a better PIP implementation.  I can only hope that Samsung will correct some of this with a firmware update because some of the features have outstanding potential.Overall this is a great TV for the money.  The only thing that could make the 750 significantly better is LED backlighting.  That is available on the 950 for about twice the price of this set.  It is rumored the 2009 version will include the LED backlighting, but then it will likely be close to twice what I paid for this set too once it is released.  If you can get a good buy on the 2008 version of the 750 it is well worth it.

Once it arrives {yes, you should buy it from Amazon and save some money VS. the brick and motar stores and their overhead}read the manual.  Once it's up and running with all of the features it offers, sit back and ENJOY.  I'm VERY pleased w/ this HDTV after extenive comparision on both the TV and pricing, on-line and in the local stores.  This was my first big purchase on-line and none of the local chain stores came close on price so, I ordered it- WHAT was I waiting for? Great customer service!

Reviews.Title: Great picture
Reviews.Author: Ranger2010
Reviews.Content: picture qualiy is very nice on digital channels paired it with a samsung wireless home theater system tv remote contols both. watching movies on this set is unreal.

Reviews.Title: Everything Was Great
Reviews.Author: Thomas Jacques
Reviews.Content: After a great deal of research I settled on the Samsung LN46A650 or the LN46A750.  The retail price had come down to $2,099 for the 650 and $2,299 for the 750.  The 750 had a couple of additional features over the 650 but not enough to make up the $200 difference.  In late January I discovered that Amazon had reduced the price to $1,515 and $1,530 for the 650 and 750 respectively.  For $15 difference I went with the 750.  Amazon sent it via their White Glove shipper; I think it was CEVA.  I had not a single problem with them.  When the TV arrived in Charleston, SC, they e-mailed me.  I called them the next day to work out the delivery details.  The set was delivered to the inside of the house, uncrated, placed on my stand and then I was shown the basics of how to use it.  Very good service.  The TV is fantastic.  My wife and I had both done our research and she agreed on the size.  When watching a movie it is better than being in a theater.  The picture quality is perfect.  The set arrived in time for the Super Bowl and I was knocked over by the picture.  You absolutely cannot go wrong with this set.  The Touch of Color banding within the glass bezel  gives this set an elegant look.

Reviews.Title: The LN46A750 is awesome ! So is Amazon
Reviews.Author: Bon Pecheur
Reviews.Content: I ordered it on a friday, was at my house by Thursday ! Got a great price , less then $1500.00 and Free shipping !It worked great and looked great right out of the box. I spent months doing research and went from the 630 to the 650 and finally on the 750 when the price difference dropped to $50.00You cant lose with this set and buying it from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: A Great TV!!!
Reviews.Author: Joe "Joe"
Reviews.Content: I purchased the tv about 3 weeks ago and I am still amazed at the quality of the product.  It is unlike any other that I have seen.  We did a lot of comparing with other tv's in the stores.  We were dead set on the Samsung tv but man does it cost a lot of money.  We did some shopping on the internet and found Amazon to be approximately 700.00$ less than what we would have paid in the store.  We ordered it, also got free shipping and had the tv in about 5 days.  It was totally painless.  After we got the tv, I set it up and hooked up the High Definition satelite and turned it on.  WOW!! What a picture!!  I am still amazed that the picture quality is that precise.  All the controls are fairly simple and straight forward to use.  The fact that it has 4 HDMI inputs is a huge plus to me.  I use my HD satelite, Hd blue ray DVD player, and my HD XBOX 360 in the HDMI inputs and still have one left over for whatever else I might need.  The tv aslo has two seperate component inputs for other things that are not high def.  I watch a lot of sports and the 120 MHZ is amazing.  This is one of the things that was a priority for me.  There is practically no blur rate when watching this tv. The contrast ratio is amazing.  The color black on this tv is actually black, not like other tvs that are not very dark.  When the tv is on a totally black screen you really can't tell if the tv is on or off.  Truly amazing product...hey it's a Samsung.  What do you expect.The 'halo affect' that you hear eveyone talk about is not that big of a deal for me.  I can see some 'haloing' at night in a dark room but for me its not that distracting.  The way that front piece is designed on the tv is what causes the affect.  I guess if I had to find a downside, this would be it, however I want to say again that it does not bother me and I would purchase this tv again if I had to.  It is a great tv and I would recommend this tv for eveyone that truly enjoys watching tv at its finest.

Reviews.Title: Samsung's A750 Outstanding Performance
Reviews.Author: Samuel H. McMillan, Jr.
Reviews.Content: I selected Samsung's A750 for its better sound quality than the A650.  And it performs as well as or better than the equivalent Sony product, which is considerably more expensive.Now I want more full-screen HD presentations without distorting the images. And I want more channels that I watch to be in HD.Amazon did an excellent job of shipping the A750, though I still don't know what "white gloves" means.I recommend the Samsung A750 HD TV wholeheartedly to prospective buyers.My only complaint has to do with the warranty, which Amazon told me was one year.  Right after I received the set, I received an email that gave me only 30 days warranty.  This difference must be clarified.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 46 Inch 7 Series
Reviews.Author: L. Perry "LME P"
Reviews.Content: Here is why I'm giving 5 stars:1) Amazon beat all local prices2) Amazon shipped exactly what they said they would in mint condition and CEVA delivered and setup exactly as advertised.3) The TV is just great, I did my research and knew I wanted the 7 series because of quality, price point, samsung being one of the industry leaders, etc.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic HDTV!
Reviews.Author: Alex
Reviews.Content: I love this TV so much its the first time I've actually taken the time to write a review about it.  For those of you who are skeptical simply read the reviews here.  Yes, they were right!  This baby has the most brilliant color I've seen, I have this TV in a room with a large amount of natural light (especially AM) and there is minimal reflection when watching.  The ToC like so many have said is so subtle you barely see it.  I haven't used it for a computer monitor yet but I'm looking forward to when that day arrives.  Everything great about this television has been stated over and over by previous reviewers so just take the time to look them over and I'm sure you won't be disapointed.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: T. Marquardt
Reviews.Content: I have had this TV for a week now and all I can say is wow!  I have tired to produce the HALO effect that some have complained about but either I am blind or it's simply not happening on my set, which was born on 01/22/09. Out of the box setting are good but after researching settings on the internet I made a few minor changes that make the picture great.The TV is in a room that gets a good amount of sun and there is some glare but not that much to disrupt viewing. This is my first large LCD TV and it's great. You can not go wrong with a Samsung product and if you shop around you can get a great price, $1229 from Sears!!!

Reviews.Title: Great LCD tv
Reviews.Author: Chethan Prabhu
Reviews.Content: I was really confused with the price ranges for these TVs and the differences in resolution etc between the different brands. We have a living room that is almost like a sun-room! The TV looks great and I am very happy with the quality of the pictures and the price.

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN46A750 is solid.
Reviews.Author: S. Sullivan "the truth hurts."
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased a Samsung LN46A750.  I was looking at the 650 for the longest time, but decided ultimately to spend (literally) a few extra bucks to upgrade to the extra DNLA features.  This TV is great.  It has all the basics for someone that just wants to sit down at the end of the day and watch TV on a beautiful picture, and there are also quite a bit of extras that advanced users and techies will enjoy.  The 120hz automotion is absolutely phenominal.  Best ever Superbowl!  Add a blu-ray to the equation and you will be blown away.  I did have an issue with the shipping company, but for the most part it was a nice transaction through Amazon.com.  This one is a no brainer.Cheapest price around + Free Shipping + No sales tax / 24 mo. SAC = Great Deal!

Reviews.Title: Great TV, Can be misleading
Reviews.Author: C. Sims
Reviews.Content: Bought through Amazon, delivered by CEVA.  Great delivery service, no problems with the bezel or separation. Not much glare when windows are to the side, minimal reflection when set up right.  "Halo effect" at night is minimal.  It seems those who complain about this are searching for a perfect TV that hasn't been made and are forgetting that their huge 32" or whatever they had back in the 90s was horrible compared to this. Used a VESA wall mount that works perfectly using the 600 x 600 settings (TV is actually 600 x 400 but it works well).  Anylink+ works great with my Samsung 1500 Blu-ray, setting up InfoLink today using a Samsung WIS08BG2X Linkstick Wireless LAN adapter that has had great reviews.  Calibration settings found on [...] and then modified slightly.  TruSurround XT works great, but normal sound is great too.  120Hz is awesome on HD channels and Blu-rays.  Used component cables for Comcast cable, an HDMI for Blu-ray.The only problem I have had was with taking the stand off.  The four screws in the back are hard to maneuver out of the holes, and the weight of the TV on the stand kept them from unscrewing correctly.  Suggest having someone hold the TV up a little while you unscrew, or put a lot of pressure when unscrewing.  Eventually got them out.  Overall, great TV, no power problems crossing my fingers.  Switching to the Blu-ray using the source button did leave it without sound once, but I just turned the Blu-ray off and on again and it worked fine.

Reviews.Title: Out of the box gorgeous!
Reviews.Author: Nidrah
Reviews.Content: The quality of the picture right out of the box (after basic setup) is absolutly gorgeous. Some of the richest blacks I've ever seen on an LCD. Colors are good and only needed some adjustment. Sound is surprisingly good, for a TV. No jaggies that I've seen. I was a little worried about the TOC being red but it's actually a classy look and doesn't stand out.

Reviews.Title: Light projects into the screen
Reviews.Author: The Doksh "Ky"
Reviews.Content: This is my first lcd screen and i noticed that we have to turn all lights off if we plan to watch TV. With my old TV, i used to watch tv at night with my 2 lamps on. Now, i have to turn everything off. I dont know if this is a problem with this TV or all lcd screens. In short, any small light will be reflect through the screen. For instance, i can see my 2 lamps throught my screen. It is so disturbing.

Reviews.Title: great product, terrible delivery. return instead of replace.
Reviews.Author: P. S. Wong "Ebook lover"
Reviews.Content: I had read reviews about how fragile the glass bezel and 'touch of red' can be.  I just did not expect the 'con' job of the Ceva delivery personnel.  They obviously saw the damage to the plastic casing behind the bezel top left corner of the tv( how can you avoid seeing it as it is right in front of your face when you lift the tv ?).  It was practically criminal how fast they rushed out of my house after they got my initials on the delivery forms.  CEVA's customer service was no help either, the response was, "Ma'am, you need to call Amazon.com."Amazon.com says they are out of stock of this TV, so Amazon will not replace the damaged tv.  Only returns are possible.  At this point, guess which one I chose ?  I'd rather have an undamaged tv at a later date then a damaged one now.Summary :  Great TV at fantastic price.  But beware of delivery service and check every inch of the product before you sign anything and let these people out your door.

Reviews.Title: Happy With My Samsung
Reviews.Author: Steve In CT
Reviews.Content: Overall, this TV has a nice picture although some of the channels that we watch look a little funny. I'm not sure what they would call the effect in the AV world, but some of the character outlines appear a little fuzzy with some channels. Other channels look perfect. And I have watched some HBO movies in HD and those look perfect. We have ATT Uverse and the TV is connected to the box with an HDMI cable. Adjustments are pretty straight forward although there are several to consider.I was a little nervous about ordering such a high priced item via the Internet but Amazon deliverd as promised and I received my TV on time and in excellent condition.

Reviews.Title: Beyond my wildest imagination
Reviews.Author: A. Sims
Reviews.Content: Keep in mind these are my initial responses to the 46" 750 and so far the set has lived up to all expectations.  At first I was somewhat hesitant to purchase this set, but after countless hours in forums and on review sites, I decided to take the plunge and bag me a 750 series.  I read about the complaints of the halo effect and so far, although very SIGHTLY noticeable, I *rarely* take note of it and have genuinely enjoyed the capabilities of this television. Highly recommended to anyone who is looking for an incredible piece of technology, as the 750 offers both audio and video superiority from many other sets that I have viewed/researched.  Enjoy the magnificent quality of this picture as I have!

Reviews.Title: Samsung 750 LCD HD TV
Reviews.Author: R. Losik
Reviews.Content: The seller was prompt and efficient in the delivery of this item.  The product was delivered securely packaged and without damage.The item included all necessary instructions and was easily set for use.  I am working to learn all the features of the item but the basic use (HD TV) is operational and functioning correctly.

Reviews.Title: GREAT TV!!!  GREAT AMAZON SUPPORT!!!
Reviews.Author: AB
Reviews.Content: First of all, the TV is exceptional!! After calibrating it with free settings I found on the internet, which used a state-of-the-art calibration device, it looks equal in picture quality to the superb calibrated display at my local Best Buy (they charge approx $300 for home calibration). High-def displays jump out at you. Standard def is also very good. My 11-yr old son loves playing his Nintendo on it. He says the scenes and sounds are too cool! Video clips and pics stored on my usb thumbdrive plug and play easily on the lcd via usb port located on the left side. I still need to buy a blue-ray player to experience the ultimate in viewing pleasure, but very happy with the quality of the speakers which includes an integrated woofer. Now here's the icing on the cake.  Exceptional Amazon large tv service (THANK YOU CADENCE!!!). I did notice the halo-effect especially with all lights turned off and blinds closed. It didn't bother me as much as other reviewers, but I did mention it to CADENCE. The great thing was she offered me a 10% credit on my purchase which was already a great price considering no tax, shipping charges, and less than the 650 model. That's $143 back in my wallet. It will go to the purchase of my Samsung blue-ray player. Another issue was with my remote. It had a loose piece of plastic rattling around inside which couldn't be removed from the battery bay. CADENCE is going to send me a Samsung link so I can get a replacement.  Be sure to register your lcd online to get the additional 3 months warranty and mail your proof of purchase to get the $200 NFL gift card.  So my true cost for this great lcd was approx $1120.  You can't beat this price anywhere!!

Reviews.Title: Great Buy
Reviews.Author: Donald L. Riley "Don Riley"
Reviews.Content: Upon purchase I immediately connected with DirectTV, and for my first 19 days of use, I am completely satisfied. Much to my surprise, I was even able with DirectTV to bring in local TV channels with rabbit ears. With only a short time of using this set, I am quite satisfied. I don't have any negative comments.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture
Reviews.Author: James Murray
Reviews.Content: Fantastic picture, highly recommend. No problems with delivery or set-up, although delivery was delayed (weather) received TV at 7:30pm. NFL AFC playoff started at 8:00PM. OMG it was great!

Reviews.Title: Extremely pleased!
Reviews.Author: K. Williams
Reviews.Content: [[ASIN:B0014175OI Samsung LN46A750 46-Inch 1080p DLNA LCD HDTV with RED Touch of Color]This is the first large purchase I have made over the internet.  It was a great experience.  I saved over 700.00 from what I would have spent if I had purchased it at the local Best Buy.  The TV is GREAT and I would highly recommend it to anyone.  It was shipped in a timely manner, and received without incident.  Thank you Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Nice TV
Reviews.Author: DenB76
Reviews.Content: I've had this T.V for 2 weeks now and love it.  It's in a room with a huge window and the glare isn't that bad at all during the day. I don't think the sound is as bad as the reviews it's getting but if you want the full effects of the movies hook up a surround sound system.There is a ton of settings you can mess around with, the only one I changed is picture mode from standard to Dynamic and the picture quality surpassed what I expected. I felt like putting on sunglasses because the picture was so bright.

Reviews.Title: LN46A750 Amazing picture!!! TOC, a problem for some.
Reviews.Author: R. Cornwell
Reviews.Content: THE GOOD: (I have this TV connected with a Direct TV HD receiver) Simply an Amazing awesome picture!!!! Best color black on any flat panel LCD TV I have seen! Ok sound. The 750 has a subwoofer that the 650 does not so claims Samsungs web site. The tv's EQ menue settings do help you adjust the sound to something acceptable but nothing is better than turning on the 7.1 audio system. The remote takes some getting used to but is ok and is not a universal remote. Infolink is a cool feature. News, weather and stock quotes at the push of a button. Auto motion plus 120HZ makes watching sporting events broadcasted in HD just amazing!!! The price from Amazon was a steal. $1461 back on Jan 12th with free shipping and no sales tax. Cheaper than the 650 on sale that day with a few more features!!! Fast shipping with Pilot and they unboxed the TV, set it on the stand and made sure it worked. This TV was in a Samsung box and due to the way it was packaged had to be new. THE ISSUE with substitute cheap lower quality Chinease panels in Samsung sets seams only related to the series 5 sets and lower. Every 650 and 750 I looked at had the Samsung panel in it. I did see 550 sets with the Chinease panels. You can check your TV by looking just behind the right side of the bezel. The last line that says "version" should start with an "S" for Samsung.THE BAD: The TOC. (Touch of Color Bezel) The only reason I can't give this wonderful set 5 stars!!! Though the bezel looks great it does cause problems depending on the TV's surroundings. When checking out and comparing the set at Best Buy in a low lit area things appear ok but the reflective face of the bezel reflects any light sourse in the area infront of the set. The TOC bezel also has another design flaw that reflects light from the screen itself to the outer 1/4" edge of the bezel. A real noticable problem in a dark room. THE FIX: I went to the Samsung web site and had an online chat with a rep who in the end told me my TV needed service. I filled out the online service request and a local Samsung authorized tech called me within the hour to confirm the problem. He told me he would order a newly designed bezel from Samsung and come out to my home and change it out for free. Seems Samsung knows of the issue, has a newly designed bezel and will change out the Bezel for anyone who requests service within the warranty. The set was maufacuted in August 2008. The set arrived with firmware version 1009.1 so I updgraded to 1012.2 from the Samsung web site just to be up to date. In the end I will keep the TV for its stunning picture quality is unmatched and I'm so far happy with the service from Samsung in fixing the Bezel issue.

Reviews.Title: Great on lowest settings
Reviews.Author: John Hancock "agam273"
Reviews.Content: This item is great, shipping was same day service once scheduled from 6th ave, bought it for under 1500 which was an added bonus. hoping to use the DLNA capabilities once I get my DLNA hard drive from Amazon.  Picture is truly amazing on the lowest setting, only using an antenna cable connected to my dish box and its great.  the TOC is hardly noticeable but it adds that true touch of quality.  Easy setup, took less than 10 minutes to get it connected.  Bought the wall mount for this unit and can't wait to post it. picture so great, once on the wall its going to look like a piece of art as opposed to a tv box.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful Picture
Reviews.Author: C. Crownover
Reviews.Content: We bought this T.V for our living room to replace our Plasma. My husband loves this T.V. The picture is beautiful and the colors are brilliant. It, in my opinion is better than our old T.V. All the extra added features are wonderful. The red touch of color sets this T.V apart from all others I have seen. We love this set it was well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: D. Dill
Reviews.Content: Awesome TV, still figuring out all the options.Blindingly fast shipping of less than a week!!!

Reviews.Title: Excellet Product
Reviews.Author: Ramiro I. Valenzuela "Ramval"
Reviews.Content: Excellent LCD TV flat panel. Amazing resolution and quality of colors. You will enjoy. No doubt. Amazon was great in handle and shipping.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: sports maniac "sports maniac"
Reviews.Content: Ordered TV Friday night and was ready for home deliver on Tuesday! Great service and excellent TV. Many inputs, pretty self explanatory and outstanding picture!AM getting HD later this week, can't wait to see this baby really shine!

Reviews.Title: Still Blown away
Reviews.Author: Robert J. Will "bwill63"
Reviews.Content: I bought this Tv on a recomendation of a friend. I was not dissapointed. I admit I am only mildly tech savy, I can find my way around this tv just fine. I can't imagine anyone being dissapointed with the picture on this set. It is just awesome! Blows me away every time I turn it on.

Reviews.Title: Awesome delivery
Reviews.Author: D. Kusel
Reviews.Content: I was impressed with the delivery: The TV was unpacked, set up, and plugged in to assure it was working before the delivery team left my home.  The Samsung TV is working well and has an easy menu to walk through.  I haven't tried the wireless internet hookup yet on this 7 series.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV!
Reviews.Author: Edward Lee
Reviews.Content: I've never seen any TV's as clear as this.  When I watch HD programming on other LCD TV's, I always compare it to mine.  I have yet to see any TV's as clear as this.Cons - When I first got the TV, it was too clear!  Yes, there is such a thing.  Took some time for my eyes to get used to it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: PraSmi "Johny"
Reviews.Content: Really, I haven't used all the full features of the TV. Anynet+ feature works really good. Anynet+ doesnot control all the features of each connected system but only few features. If you really concerned about price, wait for sometime for the price to go down or buy 650 or 550 would suffice more for the needs.

Reviews.Title: Short and Sweet
Reviews.Author: Satisfied
Reviews.Content: Without waisting a lot of words - the TV is fantastic and although I was somewhat apprehensive about buying on line the experience was wonderful. Amazon's price was the best and their white glove service can't be beat. I was expecting it on the 6th and it arrived on a Saturday the 2nd.

Reviews.Title: Samsung is great
Reviews.Author: L. P. Mercer
Reviews.Content: Samsung LN46A750 46-Inch 1080p DLNA LCD HDTV with RED Touch of ColorGreat picture and sound.  Also, Amazon had free shipping and no tax - best deal I found by >$350.00.  Delivery was to the TV room with all packing material removed.  Can't beat the deal and the TV.  120 hz makes an amazing picture and the connections are numerous.  Sound is excellent even without the home theater turned on.

Reviews.Title: Unbelievable TV
Reviews.Author: ckbook
Reviews.Content: Pros: Everything -- picture, athestics, menu, featuresCon: Not sure I really notice the so called "Touch of Color"I was very satisfied with the delivery service from Ceva.  Also the halo effect other people have complained about is not visible to me.

Reviews.Title: great choice
Reviews.Author: Marlene Merchant "marj"
Reviews.Content: We had a 25 year old TV and upgraded to this Samsung. It will take a while to adjust to the short/wide screen, as our old one was square 38x38. We only have access to a few hi-def stations but WOW! What a super product. This unit was simple to connect with included diagrams, and the menu etc. is easy to navigate. The warranty card was missing and when I phoned tec support for a new card, I got a woman that could pronounce no  words in english. but... On-line product registration/warranty was easy enough. five stars for the unit.

Reviews.Title: Best TV I've ever had!!
Reviews.Author: Rodney Jackson
Reviews.Content: This TV is awesome!  Samsung has without a doubt the best 120hz tv's period! Yes that even includes Sony.  Auto motion plus rocks and it really shows when you play videogames.  Flat out everything looks better imo with auto motion plus on.  Look if you don't get this tv you will regret it.  Sony has tried to emulate Samsung but their 120hz tv's are not as good.  Don't believe me, do your own research.  Anyway I also have the tv on my network so I can stream my photos, video, and music from my computer flawlessly. Also auto motion plus gives a bump in quality to your video streams.  Freakin sweet!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Love, Love, Love this Samsung!!!
Reviews.Author: Midwest Monty
Reviews.Content: This is a high-ticket item and so like most of you I spent a lot of time researching reviews before deciding... I ultimately chose this model.I can tell you that not one feature of this set has let me down or made me regret my purchase.  I simply love this t.v.!!  At this price point, there is simply no other set that comes close in performance and features, period.  And trust me, I reviewed many, many sites and brands.Also noteworthy, maybe the halo effect that others wrote about was a problem for them, but I do not have it and so either the manufacturer fixed the problem or it's an anomaly.The picture clarity, ease of hookup and use, multitude of connection options, leading edge multi-media functions (like watching movies or looking at pictures from a flash thumb drive), wireless connectivity via the relatively cheap usb adapter bought separately, 120Hz processor, 4 ms response time for gaming consoles, etc...Samsung knows LCD... this is the one.  The only other sets I would buy over this one is the newer 8 or 9 series Samsung LCDs.  The 9 series has a ridiculously high contrast ratio.

Reviews.Title: A great TV, I'm happy I bought it.
Reviews.Author: L. Silvers
Reviews.Content: I've owned the Samsung LN46A750 for over a month now, and I'm very pleased with the purchase. Like many others, I read lots of reviews and went to several stores to look at the TV sets. Since the beginning I wanted an LCD, not a plasma, because I had read that LCDs consume less electricity and are less heavy. My first choice was a Sony, but after reading several reviews in the Amazon site and on Consumer Reports, and having compared the TVs at the local Best Buy store, I decided to buy the Samsung. This has been by far the largest purchase that I've ever made on line, so I was quite hesitant and anxious about it. Everything turned out great, though. The price at Amazon was excellent (quite a deal, in fact), and the delivery service was fine. The set arrived a couple of days before the promised date, the company called to set up a time, and two people brought the set into my house, unpacked it and set it on the cabinet. They also made sure that the TV worked by turning it on. I have no complains at all, they were courteous and I got what I expected. I connected all the different cables and devices myself, it was easy and straightforward. I have HDTV service from Dish, and it's wonderful. The picture quality is excellent and the controls are easy to maneuver. I've been fiddling with color, contrast, brightness, etc. to get the picture that I like, and it hasn't been difficult. The sound quality is fine by me. There are several preset choices that would satisfy most people. The red edge around the screen doesn't bother me at all; on the contrary, I think it gives the TV a high-end finish and the result is quite beautiful. I recommend this TV without any qualms.

Reviews.Title: WOW !
Reviews.Author: James J. Park
Reviews.Content: This picture has to be seen to be believed. It was delivered on time and in great condition. The white glove service was very helpful. thumbs up

Reviews.Title: A terrific set, but might consider the 650 instead.
Reviews.Author: W. Evers
Reviews.Content: The good: Picture is amazing, sound is terrific, set-up a snap, white glove delivery from Amazon went very well.  The small wheel on the remote is a bit cumberson, but not bad.The bad: Glare is a problem.  Also, you will get some glow around the frame edge of the set.  May be a problem for some.Overall: I purchased the 750 over the 650 because of the ability to interact with the PC.  I haven't been able to get it to work. And from what I can tell in the manual, it doesn't seem to offer a whole lot. Happy with the purchase, but if I were to do it again, I would have saved myself the extra money and went with the 650.

Reviews.Title: I would recommend this TV great picture!
Reviews.Author: Jer Dan "& the Clan"
Reviews.Content: This TV has a very good and clear picture, we would highly recommend it to anyone that is looking for a LCD, we have done a lot of research on LCD's and this by far had the clearest and best picture for the money. We also like the looks of the red it is a beautiful touch! When they delivered it to my home; they were right on time and very nice. All together we have had a GREAT experience with Amazon.Thanks,Jerdan

Reviews.Title: Worth Every Penny I Paid
Reviews.Author: Boogie Man
Reviews.Content: I have had this tv for over half a year and I still love it.  The picture is great, you don't get bad glares from the sun or lights, and the size is awesome!Few notes:-The clear outer bezel has not affected my viewing enjoyment good nor bad-The DLNA capabilities do exist, but I still prefer to stream to my PS3 if given a choice-HDMI + this tv = awesome-The speakers do surprisingly well on their own

Reviews.Title: LN46A750 Samsung
Reviews.Author: David E. PAXSON
Reviews.Content: I just got my LN46A750 Samsung TV The picture is great but the reception is not , I was able to get several more channels on my old 27" Sharp than I can on this set I dont know if it will get better after the broadcast goes totally digital but at this point I am unhappy with the reception on this one

Reviews.Title: The HD Picture Is So Lifelike It Makes You Part Of The TV
Reviews.Author: Bruce A. Chatt
Reviews.Content: The HD channels and 1080p playback of DVD's is just so amazing with the 120Hz picture. Delivery was on time and we unpacked the TV, fired it up and the delivery guy waited to make sure it worked properly. Reviews.Title: Our Introduction to HDTV
Reviews.Author: F. Duane Ingram "FDI"
Reviews.Content: Our Samsung 750 was delivered in excellent shape after traveling halfway across the country.  Only one man came with the delivery truck, so I helped lift it off the truck and carry it into the house.  The truck driver would not help lift my old set out of the way because of his "bad back."  So much for the "white glove service."  A couple of days later my son was able to come over and help me exchange the units.  As a 71-year old retiree, I found moving the Samsung to be no problem when there was someone to help.  The other surprising aspect was that the next business day after ordering the set, I received an email from Amazon informing me that the price of the set was now $40 less than I had paid.  My efforts to be provided the reduced price were in vain.The two days I had to wait for installation of the new set permitted time to play with it using an antenna.  When installed, our cable service is available.  With either antenna or cable, the picture is just nothing less than fantastic.  Unfortunately, normal broadcasts look pretty poor after seeing images in HD.  We find few broadcast in 1080p.  Rarely programming will use 1080i, since most HD programming seems to be in 720p.The only real disappointment with the set it the strange way picture-in-picture, PIP, is handled.  One of the features that led me to select the Samsung was the promise of PIP, a feature I particularly appreciate in our old, analog TV.  The PIP feature is available only when a device is connected and active that does not require the V-Chip.  Turning off the V-Chip in SETUP is not sufficient to permit PIP.  Apparently, the feature must be deactivated through use of a device that does not have a tuner.  We have a Samsung combination VCR-DVD, each component of which is independently connected to the TV.  PIP is not possible while the VCR is active, but it is available when the DVD is connected through the S-Video input.  Even when using PIP, picture swap is not possible, so there is little about the PIP feature that has been designed to make it a useful addition to an otherwise great TV.

The infolink is really a nice feature, but it doesn't diplay all of your pictures or movies.  You need to show only a few at a time, delete them, then show more.The PIP is really a rip off..  It doesn't work unless you have another device with a tuner althought I still haven't got it to work yet. (I have a Digital convertor box and a VCR and it still doesn't see them a tuners) I was suprised that the tv does not get very much information as to what channel ID's are (like WGN, WTTW, ect;) or even what is on.  Very  few channels have this information.  My old CRT TV almost always had information for every channel and for days ahead as well.Overall, I am happy with it and love the picture quality of the digital stations, but the analog stations look worse than my old CRT TV.  You can delete all the analog stations so it skips them, and goes to the digital one instead. (delete 5, and watch 5-1 instead!)

Reviews.Title: Dramatic picture
Reviews.Author: Zergling For Hire
Reviews.Content: I do not notice the touch of color in the frame of the TV, but I can see how if you have light behind your TV, the "halo" might get annoying.  It seems a simple solution to move the light source to the side of, or in front of the TV so that there is no light coming from behind it.  (Although, for those with living room arrangements that cause the window to be behind the TV, you may find yourself annoyed by "halo")The sound is good but not great, I am using my stereo system speakers to output the sound from Cable/DVD in a configuration much like having a receiver (the receiver is next on the purchase list).  I noticed that HDMI from either input source results in the sound output from the TV (HDMI interface) and the stereo (RCA cables) are not synced (the TV sound occurs a fraction of a second before output to RCA, resulting in an echo), so I am forced to mute the TV.  This will hopefully be resolved when I switch to a reciever (but it's not a huge loss if it doesn't, again, muted TV.)  This isn't the TVs fault, but the stereos fault, since the stereo does not support a digital interface (HDMI) for sound.The picture is beautiful.  It comes default with the LCD display set to full power always, but I tuned the TV and now when I'm looking at static pictures (or TIVO control panels) the TV reduces power consumption automatically.  The UI is not necessarily intuitive, but I didn't have any problems with it.Integration via Anynet+ with other Samsung products (BluRay DVD in my case) is fantastic, allowing you to use a single remote for all of your devices.  I have some non-Samsung products (like Tivo and Cable TV) so I'm still forced to get a universal remote (I did, and it works great).  As great as Anynet+ is, I won't be buying a Samsung receiver because I have non-Samsung products...  but if I could go all Samsung, Anynet+ is very attractive (saving over $100 on a remote is probably worth the few extra dollars per product to get that kind of integration.)

Reviews.Title: Great LCD; bezel design flaw ruins it for me
Reviews.Author: Stephen F. Baugh "docportland"
Reviews.Content: First off, I'm not a videophile, but I'm pretty discerning (I'm a doctor, not an engineer!).  I recently decided to upgrade everything in my TV room, and purchased Samsung LN46A750 46-Inch 1080p DLNA LCD HDTV with RED Touch of Color to go on a new entertainment console.  I've enjoyed the TV for two weeks, but today decided to return it for Panasonic Viera TH-46PZ800U 46-Inch 1080p Plasma HDTV (which ended up to be $300 cheaper at Magnolia Hi-Fi--another bonus!)"But why?" you ask...1)  While the LCD produces great contrast and very decent blacks, the image always seemed a bit cartoony, and decidedly 2-dimensional.2)  No matter how I changed the settings, it kept trying to adjust the screen slightly (either brightness or contrast, I'm not really sure) depending what was on the screen.  If the image had two people on the screen standing, and another walked in from the side, it would either dim or brighten the screen.  It is subtle, to be sure, but after awhile it was annoying.3)  My biggest complaint is with the beveled bezel.  While sitting on the couch (standard couch, I'm 6'5" and the console is 23" high; TV is 8 feet from me), I was constantly annoyed by a refraction into the frame bezel, particularly on top.  Basically, light is refracted thru the plastic bezel, most of which is nice and black, but when it hits the beveled clear edge, there is a one-half inch strip of annoying light that matches up with what is on the screen.  So, if a guy in a white shirt walks across a dark screen, you will see a white bar traveling across the bezeled edges of the frame, inches away from the actual image.  I had 4 friends come over, and while all saw it, it really only bothered half of us...so go figure.So, I opted for the plasma as noted above.  No annoying bezel refraction, and the image seemed much more natural and organic, resulting in less eye strain.  There was a pleasant depth to the images that the LCDs in the store lacked as well.  Hopefully I'll like it as much once it's in my house, but I decided I just couldn't live with the Samsung LCD.  If I was going to use it as a big computer monitor, I would have kept it, but for natural-looking movies and HD TV, I think plasma is the way to go.

Reviews.Author: M. Storms
Reviews.Content: The Touch of Color bezel is made of such cheap, soft plastic that it is impossible to dust or clean (or even touch) without causing fine scratches, which eventually form white hazy patches all over the frame. No matter how carefully you try to protect the plastic or how gently you try to dust or clean it, it scratches. What's worse, the fine scratches pick up and reflect any lights in the room, causing harsh glaring patches of reflection around the TV.I called Samsung customer support twice about the problem and all they said was "we don't warrant physical damage."It's a shame Samsung used such cheap, soft plastic for the bezel because this is otherwise a very good TV. But you can't stand to watch the picture because your view is constantly distracted by the ugly glaring patches reflecting back from the bezel.My advice it to spend your money on a TV with a traditional metal or solid black bezel.

Reviews.Title: "halo effect" intolerable
Reviews.Author: J. Myers

Hoping the 850 won't have this ridiculous characteristic, but the images I've seen so far look as though it has the same 45-degree clear bezel edge... awaiting the reviews.EDIT 9/26/08:  Per the 8th comment below, Samsung now appears to be acknowledging and servicing this issue.EDIT 10/4/08:  Various forum comments from people who have received the Samsung "fix" (bezel replaced with a modified bezel) for the halo effect are indicating that it did not solve the problem for their sets.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, awfull delivery service
Reviews.Author: G. Abreu
Reviews.Content: So,After selecting Amazon as the retailer of choice for my Samsung LCD TV, I opted for the "white Glove" delivery service option. This has been nothing but a nightmare. Product was due to arrive on August 6th. No calls, e-mail alerts etc... I finally contacted them today and was cordially bounced around from  CSR to CSR. Now they have promised to deliver by tommorow I will have to wait and see. I have seen the TV at local retailers and it is phenomenal. I am looking forward to seeing it at my home. I cannot however recommend Amazon as a reliable retailer for shipping, so far it has been a truly miserable experience.
